channel.title: South on Every Corner of Korea

item.title: Surfing trip between men, Songjeong Beach, Busan - Haeundae-gu, Busan, South Korea
item.description:
Local surfer surfing at Songjeong Beach

Surfing trip between men, Songjeong Beach, Busan

Haeundae-gu, Busan, South Korea

Surfing is no longer the subject of a movie or a longing. Yangyang, Taean, and Pohang have already established themselves as surf spots. What's the theme of this, because men are building strong friendships? In particular, the Songjeong Beach in Busan is suitable for beginners, making it perfect for first surfing.
Man travel, friendship and challenge surfing!
For several years, the fever of tvn <Youth over Flowers> has been strong. The ringing was loud for the cast and men in their 20s and 40s. In the meantime, there were many bad trips (?) For men's trips. However, <Youth over Flowers> harmonized with men's sticky friendship and the theme of 'challenge', dreaming of a healthy trip with friends.
Songjeong Beach, popular as a surf spot as well as a beach
Surfing satisfies both themes of 'friendship' and 'challenge'. Surfing in Hawaii or the Gold Coast is a misunderstanding if you think that surfing on the Internet is only a matter of other countries. There are more surf spots in Korea than I thought, including Yangyang Jukdo, Taean Manripo, Pohang Chilpo, and Jeju Jungmun. The equipment is also simple and relatively easy to access. It is no longer left as one of the bucket lists. It will be a challenge to meet your friends. There is nothing better than this, as we learn together and build up friendships.
Surfholic's exterior where you can learn to surf at Songjeong Beach
Among them, Busan Songjeong Beach is a good place to start surfing. Since the South Sea and the East Sea meet, the south swell from spring to summer and the northeast swell in winter can enjoy surfing in all seasons. In addition, the waves of the knee are frequent and the lessons are conducted at the depth of the waist, making it perfect for beginners to surf. Currently, about 10 surf schools and equipment rental companies have entered the beach. Local surfers have already emerged since the late 1990s, and almost 20 years have passed. International surfing competitions have been held since 2009. It is worthwhile to be a mecca of surfing in Korea.
Surfboards on display at Surfholic
Surfing, there is an entrance, but there is no exit
For lessons, use surfing schools such as Surfholic and Songjeong Surfing School around Songjeong Beach. Songjeong has been systematically taking classes since the first generation surfers in Korea took root. The course is generally divided into Day 1, Day 3, and Day 5.
Surfing lesson day 1 theoretical training
Day 1 is followed by theory, ground exercises, and practice of acquisition. The theory explains the title of each part of the board, the rules of surfing, and safety.
Day 1 surfers practicing paddling on the sandy beach
Ground exercises are conducted on sandy beaches. The basic movements of the surf are paddle padding to paddle with your arms when the waves come in, push-ups to raise your upper arms to reach the waves, and take-offs to raise your knees to the lower body, finally balancing and riding the waves Is divided into Repeat this motion on the sandy beach to wear it. It is boring, but the performance of practice is directly related to the practice. Of course, I usually realize this after a few bumps on the water.
Surfboard prevents loss by connecting with the leash cord of the surfer ankle
At first, the water practice is on the board with the help of the instructor, rather than speeding up with paddling. At this time, the position of the foot on the board, the gaze, and the process of quickly converting from push-up to take-off are important. Repeat this a few times and notice the timing of the waves. Quick learners stand on the board in two or three turns and ride the waves.
Push-up posture while standing on the surfboard
On the second day, start with paddling and practice climbing yourself. If the board focuses on going straight in by the 2nd day, from the 3rd day, challenge the side riding on the oblique side of the wave surface. Day 4-5 is the process of deepening what you have learned until day 3. The cost is around 65,000 won on the first day and 150,000 won on the third day, including equipment rental. Personal training is only possible after learning at least 3 days. Of course, after the 1st day experience, most of them continue until the 3rd day.
Surfers heading to the sea for surfing
Surfing is very special because it slides on the water. It is a pleasure that you have never felt before. It has a different charm than a snowboard running on a snowy field. It's hard to break up once you fall into the charm that flows like a fish over the waves. "Surfing is like a mob. Once you're in there, there's no exit," said Kelly Slater, former World Surfer (WSL) champion. Surfing is a passionate and fascinating report.
Surfboard as a symbol of Songjeong Beach
The class time is about 3 hours per day. Starting in June, you can overlap with the surfers, so you will teach in the surf zone. In the summer, there are many people who want to learn to surf, so it's a good idea to challenge before the peak season begins. Some companies, such as Surfholic, lend their equipment and help them practice personally even after the class is over until May.
You can ride the wave with only 1st day training
Surfing is not greatly affected by the weather. It is good to surf in the rain on a rainy day. You can't swim because you wear a buoyant suit. In addition, the surfboard is connected to the ankle with a leash cord, making it easy to manage underwater. Preparations include a swimsuit, light toiletries and sunscreen. Beginners are advised to make a reservation after confirming in advance as low tide time is safe. Children can challenge if they are over 135cm tall.
Surf training is relatively safe at shallow water
Trip to Busan, Walking along the tracks of Songjeong Station
After surfing, go to Songjeong Station on the East Sea Nambu Line at the entrance of the beach. Songjeong Station was opened in 1934 and was designated as a registered cultural property in 2006. In 2013, the Donghae Nambu Line reached its end of life and lost the function of the station. I can feel the faded time everywhere. Currently, it is operated as a citizen gallery. Works were installed inside and outside the station.
Permanent exhibition inside Songjeong Station
The Donghae Nambu Line has also been reborn as an old trail. It is 4.8km from Songjeong Station to Cheongsapo Saegil to Mipo Crossing. They go through short tunnels and walk while looking at the sea. Either from Songjeong Station or Mipo, it takes 40 minutes to Cheongsapo Saegil and the rest of the trip takes about 40 minutes. When walking is a burden, you can take a walk around Songjeong Station lightly.
Travelers walking on the old road of the Donghae Nambu Line

item.title: I go skiing in the summer! Exploring Yongpyong Resort - Pyeongchang-gun, Gangwon, South Korea
item.description:
Summer ski resorts are all `` green ''

I go skiing in the summer! Exploring Yongpyong Resort

Pyeongchang-gun, Gangwon, South Korea

Is it a tree frog? Be sure to visit late spring or summer, not winter. The ski slopes at this time of year when the white slopes have turned into a lush green garden and the crowds have disappeared are peaceful. What do you have to do at the ski resort on summer days? You do not know. Unique summer sports fills the ski and snowboard retreat. In the early weekend when the hot weather was on the rise, Yongpyong Resort in Pyeongchang, Pyeongchang, Gangwon-do, enjoyed the exhilarating sports.
Do I try MTB too?
Confession, there was a time when I was looking for a ski resort to learn skiing. But one day I realized Not everyone can love skiing and snowboarding. Especially if you're as cold as you are. Unfortunately, it wasn't until summer that I was able to walk back to the ski slopes. One hot summer, at Daegwallyeong Yongpyong Resort, I faced the cool and lush landscape and wind.
As the heat started early this year, he led his family to Daegwallyeong. Daegwallyeong is much cooler than other areas, and there are plenty of things to do, including exotic ranches and large resorts. So it's perfect for a cool and exciting summer day.
We go to Yongpyong Resort for a walk and enjoy sports. Summer ski resorts have a different color and atmosphere than winter. The white-white landscape hides its traces and the surroundings are 'green'.
People enjoying MTB at Yongpyong Resort
The first thing you noticed at Yongpyong Resort is the MTB riders who race through the green. A group of riders ride their bikes downhill and jump from a slightly protruding chin. At the moment, the bicycle disintegrates and descends. It's short, but it makes a strong impression as if you were dealing with a slow motion effect. Watching riders jump from young children to adults.
The scene of jumping is thrilling just by looking at it.
Suddenly, it reminded me of the scenery I saw in Whistler, Canada many years ago. It was a fresh shock when many riders raced down the MTB at Whistler Ski Resort, which was standing on the summer road. Riding the bicycle while the wind was cool and exciting. Let's learn MTB to Koreans outside Korea. To challenge spirit. Of course, it's been a while since then.
MTB Riders Spot the Grass
A few years later, he faced an MTB riding scene at Yongpyong Resort. In the meantime, there has been a bicycle boom in Korea and many MTB users. At the same time, two MTB parks, which consisted of naturally mountain bike trails, began to emerge. Yongpyong Resort MTB Park opened in 2015. People come from various groups, including clubs, family and friends. Adult men and women as well as teenagers use the MTB park.
MTB Riders Spot the Grass
I went to the MTB center and riders gathered on the deck for a while. There are men in their 40s and 50s who came from the club, and middle school students who came to the MTB park for the first time and high school students who came with friends. Foreigners who have taken a plane to experience Yongpyong Resort MTB Park are also eye-catching. They come from Ireland and Thailand and have been riding the MTB here for three days and the course is quite attractive.
Various people enjoy the MTB Park.
'I want to ride once MTB' comes up again. Is it possible to use Yongpyong Resort MTB Park even for beginners without equipment preparation? Of course. There is a separate course for beginners at MTB Park, and rental bicycles and protective gear. MTB Park staff will also accompany the participants several times to guide the course. If you feel that you are familiar with the course, you can enjoy riding alone.
People preparing to depart MTB
You don't have to be scared how to climb a bike. This is because it is a course where you go up the lift and enjoy the downhill. There are originally five courses, depending on how each course is combined. You can enjoy 15 different courses.
Lift boarding ground
Admission tickets are 25,000 won for half day including lift fee and 35,000 won for weekly.
I am riding MTB under the lift.
Exhilarating sports to forget the heat
What if they are so envious of riding the MTB and aren't ready to ride right now? Enjoy the mountain coaster. You can ride a mountain coaster instead of a bicycle to race through the meadow. Take the same lift as the MTB riders to the boarding area.
Take the lift to the mountain coaster boarding area
Mountain coasters ride on sleds and slide down rails. Yongpyong Resort Mountain Coaster has a total length of 1300m and a maximum speed of 40km. The feeling of speed with bare body is quite fast. The operation method is easy. Speed up and slow down with one lever. Young children can also be used with their parents. Feeling like you're sliding down a green mountain foot is the `` let '' itself!
Ride through the forest on a mountain coaster
When you come down the mountain coaster, you will see buggy cars and four-wheeled motorcycles aside. Ride a buggy or four-wheeled motorcycle and off-road against the green slopes. It's not a good road, but a fun driving experience in Yongpyong Resort's nature. It feels cool to ride a bumpy road on a buggy.
Let's run off-road with buggy car
There are also leisure facilities next to the Buggy River Four Wheel Motorcycle Experience Center. There are various experiences to satisfy every age group from young children to adults. Children's electric cars, air bumper cars, triway, horse riding and so on. There's also a Segway, which Steve Jobs praised as "the best invention ever since PC" (unfortunately, it didn't resonate).
There is also an electric car for children.
Segway was developed in 2001 by an American inventor named Dean Carmen. One person stands and rides on the balance of the body. The sensor measures the occupant's center of gravity movement in hundredths of a second, balancing it against falling. It can be used from the 3rd grade of elementary school and from 20kg or more
There are various experiences such as horse riding through the meadow.
Listen to the guide and learn the basics. There is no device like a brake at all. Only body balance moves. Anyone can enjoy the basic motions such as forward, stop, and rotate. It consists of a course where you learn the basics and take a look around with your guide. The general experience lasts about 20 minutes and the mountain experience using the mountain segway takes about 30 minutes.
Segway that anyone can easily enjoy by learning the basics

Her 40-year-old husband and 10-year-old daughter raise their thumbs after riding the Segway. It's very fun. Well… . The downside of Segway is aftereffects. My husband wants to buy a Segway, and her daughter searches for the internet and asks her to go to Yongpyong Resort for a Segway ride. You may have to endure this aftereffect.


It's getting hotter. If you are looking for a cool and fun place, put Yongpyong Resort on the list. You will agree with the 'frog frog' traveler's claim that skiing is a fun place in summer.

Take a look around with the guide

item.title: The best hidden unexplored east coast, Gangneung Hunhwa-ro Drive Course - Gangneung, South Korea
item.description:
Gangneung Hunhwa-ro, known as the road closest to the sea in Korea

The best hidden unexplored east coast, Gangneung Hunhwa-ro Drive Course

Gangneung, South Korea

Along the winding coastal roads, the landscape changes. Calm white sand stretches out calmly, while magnificent rock formations appear rough. Some of them move on the surfboards and move wildly, while others lay down a fishing rod and remain silent. Gangneung Hunhwa-ro is a place where you can run along the indigo sea and face the harsh and mild scenery.
With a wreath of the legend of Mrs.
Hunhwaro runs from Gangneung Geumjin Beach to Jeongdongjin Port. Hunhwa-ro has Jeongdongjin to the north and Okgye Beach to the south. In 1998, the Jinjin-Shimgok Port section was opened for the first time, and the 2001 Shingok Port-Jeongdongjin Port section was extended. In Geumjin, the Simgok section is a coastal road, and in Simgok port, the Jeongdongjin section is an inland road. The coastal road to Hwahwa-ro filled the sea. It is known as the closest road to the sea in Korea. In fact, when you run down this road, you feel like you are running on the sea.
“Hunhwa-ro” that goes well with the background of “Hunhwa-ga”
But why is the name of the road as a wreath? It is reminiscent of <Hunhwasa> in The Three Kingdoms History. Mrs. Su-ro, wife of Sun Jeonggong in Gangneung Taesu in the Silla era, was famous for being a savvy woman. Mrs. Su-ro went to Gangneung for a while and rested at the beach. At that time, I saw a beautiful rhododendron bloom on the cliff and asked if there was a tooth to pick, but all said it was impossible. However, an old man who passed by said that he picked up flowers and gave them to Mrs. The background of the story fits nicely with the scenery of the place, so it was named “Hunhwaro”.
The sea seen from Hunhwaro is magnificent and clear.
The narrative is the background, making the Hunhwaro a deeper and more mysterious space. But it is not only the narrative that makes the wreath special. The stunning view that blends with the coastal road is also a big attraction. It's as vivid as the waves that touch the rocks. In fact, waves are so close to the sea that sea water is pushed down the road. Nowadays, the visibility is better than in 1998, when it was first established. After the road was damaged by the waves, it was renovated in 2008. Previously, the roadside balustrade had a height of 1.2m, which obscured the view. The strange rock formations and the superb view of the sea rush into the snow.
Low roadside fences obstruct vision
Relaxing Jinjin Beach with vintage cafes and surfers
With the offering, the drive can be started from Jeongdongjin or Jinjin. You can enjoy the superb view in any direction, but if you're in the first place, start with Jinjin. You can feel the climax of the scenery that starts calmly and reaches the peak. Entering the Hunhwa-ro from Okgye IC and running towards the sea, there is a point that is gently turned to the left. This is where the cool scenery of the wreath begins. When the sea hides and hides and turns around the corner, it appears like a “gift of surprise”. Many people stop in the calm seascape. There is ample parking and a seating area to relax.
There is a view and rest area at the beginning of Geumjin Beach.
A seaside shelter is also available, or a vintage café across the street. The cafe has a small sign of “red tea cafe” on its simple appearance. The name is unique.
'Red Tea Café' Signs
The owner of the cafe originally ran a red food truck on the parking side. It was famous as a toast restaurant among those who visited Hunhwa-ro. Thanks to its popularity, it now runs a store. It was named `` red tea '' in the image of the red truck that was a trademark.
Neat atmosphere inside the cafe
The building used to be a restaurant was remodeled. It's not overly stylish, so it goes well with the simple Jinjin beach. Sitting on the outdoor terrace overlooks the sea.
A cool view from the red cafe terrace
You can taste homemade burgers, coffee, and drinks as well as toast, which has been a popular dish since the food truck.
A hearty homemade burger in the red cafe
If you enjoyed the sea while enjoying the yogi, now is a good time to enjoy the beach. Quiet and secluded Geumjin Beach unfolds before your eyes. The news that tens of thousands of people gathered at Gyeongpo Beach and Haeundae during the summer season seems like a distant world. Geumjin Beach is secluded even in midsummer. There are many regular summer vacationers who are attracted to such attraction.
People enjoying leisurely surf at Geumjin Beach
A few years ago, surfing spots have become popular and related companies are spawning. It's also fun to watch the novice surfers who have the opportunity to ride the waves while surfing the board. If you watch surfers running skillfully on the waves, you will be motivated to learn.
There are surf schools all over the beach
White rice in Hunhwa-ro, Geumjin Port-Simgok Port
Enjoy a leisurely rest at Geumjin Beach, then head back to Hunhwa-ro. You can ride a car or bike, or just walk. From Jinjin Port to Simgok Port, it can be said to be the beauty of Hunhwa-ro. The meandering views spread along the winding coast. The scenery created by the rock formations and the indigo sea creates a moist feeling for even the most blunt.
You can ride a bicycle as a wreath.
In the middle of the road, you stop and look at the sea. It is a wasteful scene to pass by car. You can also park your car at Simgok Port or Geumjin Port. The distance from Jinjin Port to Simgok Port is about 2km. I recommend walking slowly, if not all sections.
Take a break from the middle and enjoy the superb view
The path from Geumjin Port to Simgok Port is on one side of the sea and on the other is a strange rock formation. It's hard to find a shop. You can use the shops in Jinjin Port or Simgok Port. Near Jinjin Port, a stall called `` Hang-gu wagon '' is famous. Some people deliberately come to Jinjin Port in search of port wagons. It is famous for its kalguksu and crab sashimi. It's a tacky small stall but there are always many customers. These simple things, combined with the magnificent natural scenery, make the wreath stand out even more.
A small restaurant near port of Geumjin Port
Travel info

item.title: A journey to Seosan's delicacies, from plain soup to traditional hotteok - Seosan, Chungnam, South Korea
item.description:
The soup is made with a blend of plain broth and crunch

A journey to Seosan's delicacies, from plain soup to traditional hotteok

Seosan, Chungnam, South Korea

The warm spring breeze blows softly and the hips are hilarious. The energy of spring multiplies the excitement of travel. It's a good season to go anywhere. The sea full of spring breeze is good and the market full of spring energy is good. If you add seasonal delicacies that will enhance your taste buds in spring, you can add icing. It would be better if the food is not common anywhere. So I chose Seosan, Chungnam, where the sea, the market, and seasonal delicacies are located.
What is soup?
If you are looking for Seosan on the west coast, many will taste Jukkumi Shabu Shabu or Urukhoe. If you add one, it's a local delicacy. The food is familiar to the Seosan people, but the name is strange to the outsiders. You can think of it as Maeuntang because it is a soup that is made with Urug. I might be worried that it will be rude. But the soup is a light dish with immaculate soup. It is closer to North Korea or Hwang than Thailand.
The main ingredient of the soup is Urugpo. Urug, also called zodiac rock, usually gives birth in spring. Because you gain weight before spawning, you can enjoy the spring season. There are many occasions where you can enjoy spring Uruk, which is full of flesh. Remove the guts and split in half and season with salt. Then, in the spring sunshine and wind, they usually dry for three days to complete Urugpo.
Now that the main character, Urugpo, is finished, let's boil the soup. You'll need a supporting shrimp sashimi, and prepare radish, green onions, and chopped garlic, which are usually served in a clear soup. Add tofu, which will add a lot of richness, and even dry peppers to give it a bitter flavor. Boil soup with rice water rather than plain water to make it taste stronger.
If you eat a piece of meat
In Urukukguk, it is 'one of the gods' that uses dried Urukpo instead of raw Urukpo. In the Seosan area, Urugpo was posted on a Buddhist memorial service, and it was said that the origin of Urugukguk was that the soup was eaten after it was finished. The dried fish makes the texture soft and chewy and doesn't have a fishy taste. The soup is so light that everyone can enjoy it. If you put the fluffy meat in your mouth, the flavor will spread. Once you drink a thick broth and bite a chubby meat, a bowl of rice disappears in no time.
Wagyu soup is made of rolled Urugpo
If you want to taste the soup, go to Seosan City's local restaurant or Samgilpohang. In Seosan city, there are several local restaurants serving local delicacies. The local restaurants, Sanhae Delicacy, and Seosan Flower Crab are popular among locals.
Restaurants for Sale
These restaurants specialize in Seosan's delicacies, such as Korean soup and crab soup, so you can enjoy the taste of local food. In addition, depending on the shop, they offer other specialties of Seosan, including crab soup, stew, and taeyeon. It is good to taste various local delicacies in one place.
Delicacies in Seosan, including Ecklonia and Gecko
Enjoy Seosan 9-mi Soup with Samgilpo Port
Samgilpohang is the best place to taste Urukhoe and Ukraint Soup against the sea. Samgilpo Port belongs to Seosan 9 View, and Urugukguk belongs to Seosan 9mi. In other words, you can enjoy special food in the beautiful scenery. Samgilpo Port, the gateway to the north of Seosan, is abundant with marine products.
Samgilpo Port
The large Uru-shaped statue built in the port and the annual Samgil-po-Luck poisoning festival represent Uru-san's main production area. In Samgilpohang area restaurant, you can easily find the menu. In the ship sashimi restaurant, the specialty of Samgil Pohang, Urug is the main character.
There is a large Uru statue in Samgilpo Port.
If you follow the signboard 'Flying Ship', the ships are lined up on the sea. Buying and selling fish is no different from any other fish market, but the space is the sea and the shop is a fishing boat.
You can buy sashimi at a sushi restaurant on board
The items sold here are mainly rockfish, songme, halibut, flatfish, and liver. Uruguay and flatfish can choose between wild and aquaculture. You can sashimi and go to a nearby restaurant to eat for a small table. After eating sashimi, you can try the local delicacy instead of spicy soup.
You can buy sashimi at a sushi restaurant on board
After a meal, take a walk through Samgilpohang. Sculptures installed in various places and seagulls flying in groups create a sight.
Sculptures are installed along the sea
Buy Urugpo and eat Hotteok, Seosan Eastern Market
You can buy Urugpo in Samgilpo Port, but if you go to Seosan Dongbu Market, you can find Urugpo and other seasonal ingredients. Seosan Eastern Market, located in the city center, is a traditional traditional market that opened in 1956. Being a central market in Seosan, I'm full of seafood and produce from the region. It's like looking around the fields and seas of Seosan even after a market round.
Seosan Dongbu Market, full of local seasonal specialties
The fish market corner is filled with fresh seafood such as jukkumi, clams, oysters and wild crab. It's as lively as the ocean. Enjoy the fun of the market with a great deal. There is a restaurant on the second floor of the fish market, where you can cook and eat seafood from the market.
Seosan Dongbu Market, full of local seasonal specialties
It's not just living seafood. As you walk inside the market, dried fish are a must. You can find various kinds of dried fish such as bakdae, flounder, and smelt. The most noticeable of these is Urugpo. Filled Urugpo is one of Seosan Eastern Market's most popular items. Aunt Merchant came to Seosan to buy Urugpo and try Urugup Soup or Urugpo Steaming. Once you're addicted to the taste, you keep buying only Urugpo.
We sell various dried fish such as Urugpo
Seosan Dongbu Market has many unique foods besides Urugpo. Emotions not common in other regions are noticeable. Eckloniagi looks like seaweed, but its color is clearer. Ecklonia vulgaris grows hard and grows wild, all of which are natural, with a rich sea scent and savory taste. You can eat it with oil like roasting, but you can just eat it.
Ecklonia can be found all over the market.
At this time, it is better to soothe soy sauce. Since soothe is mainly produced in Seosan, you can buy it all at the market until you can soothe it. Let's buy one more before we leave the market and buy it.
It can be found all over the market.
Grandmother Hotteok. If you enter the market place from the parking lot of the market, you will see the trade name 'Old Bakery'. You can feel the 'force' from the hotteok plate like the green drum. These days, it's hard to see these hot cakes. The oil is lightly brewed with a very light coat. The secret to the taste is the dough made with makgeolli and acorn jelly instead of chemical additives. The chewy and delicious taste is attractive. It is also fun to see the skillful work of grandmothers who have worked for decades.
'Old Bakery' and 'Marketing Original Ho-teok'
There is another famous hot rice cake at Seosan Dongbu Market. If you enter the alley where Sundae Gukbap and Kalguksu are gathered to the side of the direct market place, you will see 'Market aid Ho Tteok'. This is also a decades old hotteok house. Seosan is a shop where locals chew on their memories. The cast iron pan and the pot lid are impressive. Bake it in a pan, cover it with a pot, and steam it slightly until it is cooked. It uses less oil and makes the rice cake taste lighter. In both houses, two hot cakes cost 1,000 won. It is a good price. After eating a bowl of soup, enjoy a hot cake of Seosan Dongbu Market as a dessert.
Let's taste old-fashioned hotteok

item.title: Flowering in front of the beach, Gimnyeong Metal Craft Mural Village - Jeju, South Korea
item.description:
Metal art murals that have naturally penetrated the village

Flowering in front of the beach, Gimnyeong Metal Craft Mural Village

Jeju, South Korea

A gentle change began along the coastline in a tranquil seaside village north of Jeju. Metal crafts with warm stories of the village bloomed on the walls of the house.
'Gojangnan-gil', which embroiders Kimnyeong village, is a Jeju dialect, meaning 'flowering path'. Sea breezes and sea water flow in the villages, and metal crafts that look wonderful as time goes by bears the warmth.
'Troubleshooting Road' starting at Jeju Olle Trail 20 Course
Permeable metal craft work
Jeju sea is always new. The moment you see the mysterious color, it's likely that fluttering will happen. Jeju's pretty beach is lined with hostels and cafes overlooking the sea. Another way to meet Jeju sea is to walk slowly along the coastline.
The sea and sky of Gimnyeong that is so blue
Gimnyeong, the starting point for Olle 20 course, north of Jeju, is a quiet village with emerald sea. In winter 2014, the change began in an ordinary town where travelers are sparse. Metal art murals were made naturally as if in a village.
Good way to walk along the beach
You can find metal crafts about 3km from the beginning of Olle 20 course to Seongseon Beach. White wings emerged from the blunt cement walls, and whales seemed to jump into the sea right now on the black stone walls. The works of Haenyeo, Gimnyeong Village, which consists of Manjanggul Cave, Cheongsugul Cave, Yacht and Wind, are included in each piece.
Interesting work that applied wall
Take a map and enter the village on Olle Trail 20. By Kim Sung Sook Welcome to this traveler. Travel is a work that expresses the root of the mind with interesting imagination.
It's fun to look for each piece on the map one by one.
The roots of her blunt feet are traveled, and metal leaves hang on top of them to form a rich tree. Works well with Jeju, the romance of travelers.
The work which soaks naturally as if originally attached
Gentle changes to bring villages to life
Did you walk 10 minutes from the start of Olle Trail 20? He enters the cafe 'Backroom Project', nestled under a green roof in front of the beach. The house is remodeled as a farm house, and the outside is used as a workshop for metal crafts. It is run by Nam Hyun-kyung, the artist who planned the streets of Gimnyeong.
Representative Nam Hyun-kyung of Café ‘Dabang Project’
She majored in metal crafts at university, and her dream was to have a workshop in front of the sea, which she settled here two years ago.
Warm room is seeping again
At first, it was a cold village, but curious seniors often visited with vegetables or fruits, and she began to tell her story. Indulged in the charm of the village, the writer searched for warming the neighborhood and chose what he could do best.
Warm room is seeping again
Painting murals are well peeled off by rain and wind and may look heterogeneous, so I chose achromatic metal as a material. In his mind, Nam wanted to make a mural that penetrated the landscape naturally. The village secretariat and the Rural Development Corporation were persuaded for nine months to complete the “Trouble Road Project. As a result, 34 works embroidered the village from the end of October to mid-December 2014.
There are many works that unravel the hearts of women
At first, the village elders did not have the opposition. I didn't know the metalwork itself, and most of all, I had to pierce the walls of my old house. But I was satisfied with the finished mural.
Sneaking through the wall, cat
12 artists participated in the project. It was recruited through SNS, and was introduced to the artist by knowing through school seniors and juniors. Gimnyeong is a seaside village, and its works are mostly made of copper rather than iron because the works can be quickly destroyed by the influence of sea breeze and seawater. “Iron is corroded, but copper is colored. The color changes nicely with sea breeze and sea water. As time goes by, the work gets more and more valuable. ” Representative Nam
Yongcheonsu can be found all over Jeju
The copper is red at first, but as time goes by, the green color rises. The emerald work creates another mood. This is also an attraction of metal crafts. Copper is twice as expensive as iron, but it is more economical because it costs no maintenance and repair.
Colorful roofs along the beach
Works that contain the story of Gimnyeong Village
Leave the project again and walk near the sea. On a wall, we discover Chu-sky's work, Island Kid. It is a work that expresses the strong mother and haenyeo of Jeju. Knowing that there are many fishing points in Kimnyeong, Lee Jung-geun's <WORLD'S BEST FISHING SPOT> shows. In his work, you can see the vibrant and dynamic village.
She stands in front of the haenyeo who goes well with the orange roof. When I look closely at the net that Haenyeo has rescued, it is a flower that bloomed in a lump. Kim Sun-young's <Blossom Wave> expresses that the flowers they have rescued for the rest of their lives are flowers, and their flower-like youth. Lee Hyun-jung's <Cantabile>, which means that fish are harmonized in the life of a haenyeo according to the sound of the sea, is as beautiful as a soft coastline. After this piece, the grandfather is drying up the starfish in the courtyard of an old house. I lived in this village for a lifetime and was bored. One day, a mural blooming like a spring flower is pleasing and the calm change makes me feel happy.
Grandpa drying his starfish in the courtyard of an old house
There are many works that portray Haenyeo, but it is a different feeling when faced with garlic artist 'Wonder HaeNyeo'. I wanted to break down the prejudice against the female divers by expressing the female divers as a wonder woman. “I think Haenyeo is a person who is doing hard work. Especially, women in Gimnyeong are strong, blunt and clunky. Because the land was so poor that I had to make material, and because of the wind and the sound of the waves, I was short and thick when I spoke. The girls and girls I met face to face with exciting music, fun work, and warmth for strangers. I wanted to express it cheerfully that the women were forced to be strong. ”
A mother and a woman who is strong like a wonder woman
In addition to the walls, there are also works that look more detailed when you look up. Lee Jung-geun's Blue Water Glass (Let's Go) is located on a stone wall. In the form of webtoons, it was a fun way to express blue water, a healing water for sick people, a swimming pool for local children, and a spring water for farmers to relax with cows.
Emerald colored metal craft in sea breeze and sea water
Lee Sung-sik's <Walk the Road> contains the mysterious legend of Duruksan, which shows off the sea in Gimyeong. It tells the legend of Durucksan that the grandmother she met on the road is always in the water.
A work that just popped out of a cartoon
Did you walk for about 2 hours? It stands in front of a work that tells the story of Gimnyeong's specialties and the wind. The story of Kim Ning, who is told by the murals, seems to tickle her.
Wall and work that seems to be one originally
Deep in the village, it is filled with works that allow the elderly to feel the wisdom and old fashion of Jeju. The broken roads throughout the seasons will make the town more daunting.
Go

item.title: Jeju's winter restaurant, comforting betrayed travelers - Seogwipo, Jeju, South Korea
item.description:
Red Camellia Flower, One of the Typical Winter Landscapes in Jeju

Jeju's winter restaurant, comforting betrayed travelers

Seogwipo, Jeju, South Korea

Jeju's winter is a season of betrayal. Many people travel in anticipation of the warm and warm weather, but when they step on the island, they feel something is wrong. Yes. Jeju's winter is much colder than I thought. The bitter winter breezes that drive every once in a while make people's minds cold. Here are two cafes where you can enjoy betrayed travelers with warm winter scenery, special experiences and delicious seasonal desserts.
Camellia walk and warm winter delicacy, Warangwarang
Wimi-ri Village in southern Jeju is an essential part of Jeju's winter trip. A fascinating camellia colony that brings out red flowers in midwinter attracts travelers every year. The Camellia colony, as its name suggests, is not a place where camellia trees form a forest, but the trees that grow along the stone walls are so huge that they look like forests from a distance. Camellia is a native variety, so the flowers themselves are not gorgeous. However, the landscape where blossoms fall and form flower paths is not enough to make the winter trip beautiful.
Camellia colony where the camellia tree grows
Just a few steps away from the camellia community, there is a café called Warangwarang, which is known for its atmospheric and delicious coffee. It is a good place to take a leisurely tour of the camellia colony and drink hot coffee to share the afterglow of the trip. The cafe's exterior, neatly decorated, is very comfortable.
Warangwarang, a cafe near the Camellia colony
production
A citrus field looks out the window
The handwritten menu is full of things to try, including a wide variety of coffees and teas, cookies and juices. Among them, sweet red bean latte and glutinous rice cake are the best delicacies of Warangwarang, which can be enjoyed as a winter dessert. The red bean latte, which is made by boiling domestic red beans, is soft and savory. Fatigue accumulated in pleasant sweetness melts away. If you have a cup of red bean latte with roasted rice cake, you won't have the perfect winter food. Slightly baked rice cakes with plenty of roasted soybean flour make it a little hungry.
A glass of red bean latte with roasted rice cake
In addition to the café, the company's owners make menus from ingredients they eat, as well as operating a certified organic citrus farm and a custom-made furniture workshop. Thanks to this, the citrus menu from the cafe is also made from high-quality citrus from the farm.
Neat and sweetly decorated cafe
Naturally aged soaps and camellia oils made by the couple are also popular. The 'warangwarang' camellia oil and soap, made by OEMs in specialized production facilities, have a reputation for being recommended.
Warangwarang coffee to enjoy with hand drip
Cafes are usually quiet and relaxed, but sometimes they turn into love rooms for residents and travelers. It opens at 11 am and closes at 6 pm and is closed on Mondays.
The cafe is decorated in a cozy and relaxed atmosphere.
Aromatic foot bath, homemade seafood bread, dolgori cafe
As you walk slowly along the wide Pyoseon Haevichi Beach, you will soon reach the Pyoseon port. It is a good place to relax with a clear sea view. Right behind Pogu is the “Doltogori Café,” where you can enjoy desserts and foot baths. The unusual foot bath made of black basalt, homemade gelato and bread are popular warm spaces.
Dolpori Café
1:00 pm. As you enter the cafe, the smell of freshly baked bread irritates your nose. Even though I have just eaten, my mouth is drooling. For those who like to eat bread, and to make bread, the Dolgori Café is just a sparrow mill. The taste is delicious, but you can taste the unique bread that is not found in other bakeries.
Homemade bread, gelato and delicious drinks baked daily
Seafood bread made with squid, mackerel, octopus and conch is a popular bread. There's nothing special on the outside, but the seafood is filled with a different force than any other bread. The texture of the soft bread goes well with the chopped seafood. If you eat one or two, the plate will be empty soon. Jeju citrus bread with sweet and sour citrus is topped with a spoonful of mango gelato. Cool and mellow gelato and sour citrus bread make a fantastic harmony in your mouth. In addition to mangoes, there are a variety of gelato so you can choose your own. Doltogo bread made with potato puree also offers a different look.
Seafood bread with a conch, sea eel, octopus and squid
The second floor of the cafe is decorated with a foot bath. If you want to enjoy a foot bath with desserts, order bread and drinks on the first floor and bring them to the foot bath table. Each foot bath has a table where you can put a drink.
The first floor is a cafe and the second floor is decorated with foot baths.
A little clunky footbath made of jeju stone. Dolgori, which means “pig trough” in Jeju, is interestingly shaped as a foot bath. Best of all, it is convenient because you can set the desired temperature.
You can enjoy foot bath comfortably while enjoying dessert.
When you apply for a foot bath experience, you will bring bath, beauty salt and towels to the basket. Once you know how to use it, you can enjoy the foot bath by yourself.
Bath salt, beauty salt, towel to apply for foot bath experience
Adding a bath will give your feet a pleasant scent and color. You can choose among yuzu, cherry blossom, forest bathing and rose fragrance. Rubbing the beauty salt on the soles of your feet before you finish the foot bath will remove the dead skin cells and make your skin smoother. Wipe dry with a single step and you're done! The fatigue of a midwinter's journey is eased. Foot bath experience is 5,000 won per person.
Put a bath in a footbath
Travel info

item.title: A flower path that looks like a camellia carpet and footbridges, Namcheonju Cheonmasan - Namyangju, South Korea
item.description:
Namyangju and Seoul from the middle of Cheonmasan

A flower path that looks like a camellia carpet and footbridges, Namcheonju Cheonmasan

Namyangju, South Korea

The wildflower trail that represents the metropolitan area is Mt. Cheonma, Namyangju. At 812m above sea level, various flowers bloom along the season without any burden. The route from the entrance of Supyeongsa in Hopyeong-dong to Cheolma's house and the Dolphin Spring is a section that can be called 'wild road'. White camellia and noodle trees, which cover the trail, bloom until the end of June. A lovely foot-shaped tree with purple flowers under the heart-shaped leaves tells a sad story when a mother and daughter miss her. Cheonmasan is now waiting for you with wild flowers, namely grasshoppers, moths, hawksbill flowers, wild pheasant's legs, grass swabs, true flower, dragonfly, and fin thistle. Take a slow look at the grass.
There is plenty to enjoy on National Highway 45, which runs alongside the Bukhangang River. Hongyuneung, where Gojong and obedience fell asleep, is also impressive.
Namyangju Cheonmasan is one of the best places to talk about hiking wild flowers in the metropolitan area. It is not very high at 812 m above sea level, but it is because various flowers bloom along the season. Normal mountaineering climbs to step on the summit, but flower mountaineering is more joyful to discover every single flower on the side of the road. You can find wildflowers hidden in the bush by bowing your head and slowing down.
Cheonma Mountain Climbing Course is diversified. A lot of people take the course from the entrance of Supjinsa in Hopyeong-dong to the summit of Cheonma House. The trail from Cheonmasan Station on the Gyeongchun Line to Cheonmasan Station, Chill Pass, and Peak Peak is also common. Wildflower visitor's favorite course is walking from Palhyeon-ri, Onam-eup, along the valley to Cheonma House or Dolphin Spring.
The Sujinsa course also runs along the valley, and there are many varieties of flowers, so if you are looking for Mt. There are many flowers and the course is short when you go up the valley. In the forest road just above Cheonma's house, you can see raspberries, mountain firebags, barberry, paulownia, and cherry tree.
Entrance to Cheonma Mountain Trail with Wildflower Information Board
Beginning at Sujinsa Temple, we walk through Cheonma's house and Dolphin Spring to Palhyeonri. Walking to find flowers, it takes over an hour to Cheonma's house.
White camellia flower covered with valley water
The camellia flower, which blooms in late spring and brings summer, is white and coveted. Just as camellia flowers are spectacular, the camellia flowers fall on the trail and cover the trails and valleys. Looking up the branches over the valley, it seems that bright white flowers are lit up brightly. It blooms from May to June and often meets around hiking trails and valleys.
A camellia lighting up the trail
It is common to eat noodles. From the bottom of the mountain to the ridge, you can see the light yellow flowers of noodles. It is easy to find purple flowers with beautiful beehives and white flowers that look like a slim woman.
Noodle Tree
If you have a heart-shaped leaf shaped like a baby palm next to the trail or on a mountain slope, stop by it. You can see the purple flowers on the bottom. It is said that the bride looks like a bride's head on the wedding ceremony. In the olden days, a lady who was chosen as a court girl went to China far away and missed her separated mother.
The flower of the foot of a tree is visible only by lifting a leaf
Some wildflowers are beautiful but dangerous. Tiannan has poison in its roots. In the fall, red berries similar to ginseng fruit are easy to be mistaken, so be careful. The sprouts have flowers and only leaves, so be careful not to mistake them for wild vegetables.
Cheonnam Province
There is a five-way street just above Chunma House. It is divided into the summit, Dolphin Spring, Hopyeong-dong (Sujinsa), Gwaneumbong / Sareung-gil, and Palhyeon-ri (Onam Reservoir). There are several benches, and there is a final toilet at the end of the road, which is where hikers rest.
Mosinabi Sucking Beetle Honey
Even if you walk here, you can see quite a lot of wildflowers. If you have enough time, go to Dolphin Spring or descend to Palhyeonri if you don't need to return to your starting point.
Children playing in the forest at the entrance of Sujinsa Course
It is relatively easy to get to Cheonma's house, but the rocky road is rough to the top. The trail to the Dolphin Springs is a must for flower trails. If you walk for 5 minutes from the five-story street, you will see a yellow guarded debt sign that is a rare native plant of Mt.
Hiker looking at yellow sitting debt community protection sign
The road to Dolphin Spring is a flowery section, but the flowers that can be seen from now until the end of June are potato orchid, big primrose, horseradish, aeginari, roe pee, goblin fan, and grass swam.
Potato Orchid
Early spring blooms of calendula, beewinds, deers, stalks and violets, only leaves and fruit remain.
Large primrose
If you climb from Dolphin Spring, it is normal, and the path that extends down runs along Cheonma Mountain Valley through Darae Mountain Garden Garden to Onam Reservoir.
Horseradish
The cherry blossom trees, bat trees, grass grass, mountain pheasant's legs and fin thistles on the trail are just before bursting with buds. Baby hoe eyes and big hoe rice that bear fruit are also worth noting.
Like a sweet lover
When you go to the Palhyeonri course, sit on the valley rocks and listen to the sounds of water, wind, and birds. It is a clean valley where salamanders and northern frogs hide in the gaps between the stones.
True flower
There is no public parking but there are restaurants along the valley where you can park after meals.
salamander
Hiking greed should be a good thing. You may not see the flowers you want, or you may be lucky to see rare plants.
Onam Lake Park
You may need to think about safety first, as you may find yourself on the trail or slip off the mountainside.
Path through the coniferous forest to the dolphin gland
Namyangju has plenty to see even under the mountains. The water garden in Jinjung-ri, Joan-myeon, is decorated with an ecological park around the wetland where the North Korean bicycle path passes. Walking in the peaceful scenery will ease your haste.
Jinjung-ri Water Garden
Namyang Organic Organic Theme Park is a great place to find a hand. There is a children's favorite Cocomong Farm Village, and you can learn more about Namyangju, the home of slow food. The Ark of Flavor exhibits the ingredients and processed foods listed in the World's Ark of Flavor, a project to revive memories and foods that are disappearing.
Namyang Organic Organic Theme Park
Route 45, which runs alongside the Bukhan River, is good to drive, and there are many teahouses and bakeries overlooking the river. Piano toilets shaped like grand pianos and piano waterfalls made from a 92m artificial waterfall with sewage treatment effluents are worth a visit.
Piano Waterfall with Piano Toilet and Artificial Waterfall
Hongyuneung, where Gojong and obedience are buried, is impressive with animal statues such as Haitai and Camel, and huge Munseok and Unmanned Stones.
Moon Yu In Seok, Hong Young with impressive animal statues
Travel info

<Day trip course>

Exploring Wildflowers and Culture / Entrance of Sujinsa Temple → Cheonma House → Dolphin Spring → Entrance of Sujinsa Temple → Piano Falls → Namyangju Organic Farm Theme Park → Water Garden
Exploring Wildflowers and History / Palhyeon-ri → Cheonma House → Dolphin Spring → Palhyeon-ri → Onam Lake Park → Hongyuneung → Mine Naru Food Culture Street

<2 Day 1 Night Course>

Day 1 / Entrance of Sujinsa Temple → Cheonma House → Top of Cheonmasan Mountain → Dolphin Spring → Entrance of Sujinsa Temple → Hongyuneung → Mine Naru Food Culture Street → Chukyeongsan Natural Recreation Forest (Stay)
Day 2 / Piano Falls → Namyang Juju Agricultural Park → Water Garden → Dasan Remains

item.title: 2018 Pyeongchang Sightseeing Road 04, Gangneung Summer Trip with Forest, Sea and Art - Gangneung, South Korea
item.description:
2018 Pyeongchang Sightseeing Road 04, Gangneung Summer Trip with Forest, Sea and Art

Gangneung, South Korea

Summer is the best trip to Gangneung. From Jumunjin to Gyeongpo, Jeongdongjin, and Okgye, large and small beaches spread out along the coastline. Among them, Jeong Dong-jin is a fantastic combination of the sea, train tracks, mountains and art. Brush-dense forest faces the sea, and there are countless works of art in harmony with the sea. Jeongdongjin Station is a different name for romance. Jeongdongjin area is close to the sea, rail bike, Hasla Art World and Gangneung Unification Park, so you can enjoy them as a day course.
Jeongdongjin rail bike runs alongside the sea
"Wow ~ my stomach is huge!"
In front of the Gangneung Unification Park Trap Exhibition Hall, a child fires admiration. It is not an ordinary passenger ship but a unique place where you can experience the largest destroyer among ships.
Gangneung Unification Park Trap Exhibition Hall
Gangneung Unification Park consists of a ship exhibition hall located on the beach from Anin beach to Jeongdongjin, a unification security exhibition hall located on the mountain a little distance away, and an outdoor exhibition hall. Most of the tourists visit only the wartime exhibition halls with easy access and many attractions. The Jeonbuk ship, located in the center of the ship exhibition hall, was built in 1944 in the United States, and was a destroyer that defended the territorial waters of Korea until the Korean navy came in 1972 and retired in 1999. It is 118m long, 12.5m wide and 27.4m high and weighs 3471 tons. Inside, you'll feel like you're looking for a labyrinth when you're in the captain's room, steering room, meeting room, infirmary, electric room, barber's room, kitchen, etc.
Steering room interior steering room
It's a trap made in 1944, so it's a huge antique museum full of old objects. Complex machinery, ceilings and devices are impressive. The front and stern decks are open to the public, and they are equipped with various facilities and weapons to impress them. The deep blue sea of the sea overlooking the ship is fascinating.
Parks and sea overlooked from Jeonbuk
The outdoor park next to the ship exhibits the submarine used by North Korean troops in 1996 and the wooden boat used by North Koreans to escape. 2 to 3 minutes by car to explore the various tanks, armored vehicles and planes in the outdoor exhibition hall.
There are several planes and fighters at the open-air exhibition hall on the hill.
Hasla is the name of Goguryeo in Gangneung. Pure Korean means sun and light. With the sea view on the mountain foot, Hasla Art World is a special space that blends mountains, sea, forests and wild flowers and artworks.
Hasla Art World overlooking the sea
It is located on the hillside overlooking the seaside of Myeongmyeong Beach, and the scenery of the sea is excellent. The sea cafe at the entrance to the open-air sculpture park spread the deck wide and made it an observatory. To the right, you can see Eomyeong Beach and Jeongdongjin far away. Widely covering the sky, the work 'Morning Glory' is a symbol of Haslla Art World. As you can see from Mondrian's abstraction, the main building with colorful colored glass on the outside is also impressive.
Morning Glory at Sea Cafe, a landmark of Haslla Art World
Hasla Art World is home to an outdoor sculpture park, Pinocchio & Marionette Museum, hotels, restaurants, sea cafes and observation decks, and art shops and galleries. If you are traveling with a child, it is a good idea to try art first. There are various experiences, such as making a moving marionette doll, making a wooden picture frame, drawing your own T-shirt, and making a kangaroo doll.
Observation deck at sea cafe with excellent ocean view
The Outdoor Sculpture Park is the highlight of Haslla Art World. The promenade next to the art experience room is the starting point of the sculpture park. There are works all around the promenade, on the branches, under the rocks, and so on. There are many tall pine trees and the sea spread over it seems to see a picture of simple fashion. There are many works that you can enjoy while playing, such as the cow dung art museum with cow dung material hanging in the air, the stone gallery with hanging stones, and the square of time where sundials and aisles are installed. At the Sky Observatory, don't miss the shadow bikes that seem to run upside down.
Children's favorite art experience
There is no such thing as the Bilendorf Venus statue overlooking the sea, the nude gallery with walls made of transparent material, and the children's favorite play garden. Inside, there are the Museum of Contemporary Art, Pinocchio Art Museum and Marionette Art Museum.
Exhibition work inside the Pinocchio Museum of Art
Jeongdongjin Station is the nearest train station from the sea. Naturally, the rail bikes that ride at Jeongdongjin Station are also closest to the sea. On-site sales are often sold out on weekends or during peak summer season. It is safe to book and find ahead. Departs every hour from 9:00 am to 5:00 pm (except 12:00).
Jeongdongjin Station and Hourglass Pine
Choose from 2 or 4 people and listen to the instructions for safety and safety after boarding. If you roll your foot only a couple of times at first, the motorized function will work afterwards. Children are cheering as they run alongside the sea. Four-seater seats are pedaled by hand instead of feet. It runs well without having to turn the hand pedal, but keeps spinning for fun. The people strolling on the beach wave their hands, and the people waiting for the train at Jeongdongjin station look at them enviously. Both the rail biker and the spectator are happy. Unfortunately, for a while, you will not be able to ride the Jungdongjin rail bike.
Jeongdongjin Rail Bike Ticket Office
Get off the rail bike and look around Jeongdongjin Station. Compared to the size of the station, many people are looking for a drama. The first thing people do is look for the hourglass pine. Passing the track on the way to the platform through history, it is a pine tree in front of you.
Jungdongjin Station still runs trains. In addition to the regular trains, special trains that enjoy the sea scenery of the East Sea called 'sea trains' are operated twice a weekday and three times a weekend. During the peak summer season, it runs three times on weekdays. It takes about 1 hour 20 minutes and 3 hours round trip to Samcheok via the East Sea. The train runs along the coastline for a great view of the sea.
Sea train between Jeongdongjin and Samcheok
The hourglass park, located just south of Jeongdongjin Station, has a view of the sea, the train tracks, the huge hourglass and the beach. A huge millennium hourglass, made to symbolize Chung Dong-jin, famous for the drama 'Hourglass', stands in the middle of the park. Hourglasses are usually shortened in five- and ten-minute increments. Millennium hourglasses are one year old.
Hourglass park with huge millennium hourglass
Next to the Millennium Hourglass is the Jeongdongjin Time Museum, a collection of steam locomotives and eight passenger cars. In addition to the sundial and the water clock, we will look at more sophisticated clock developments as science develops and appreciate the beautiful clocks produced in medieval Europe. There are also some unusual clocks made out of ingenious ideas and a few rare watches from around the world.
Jeongdongjin Time Museum to Awaken the Preciousness of Time
On one side of the park is a sundial made of bronze. The tip of the needle, shaped like an arrowhead, faces North Star. Calculate the time by looking at the shadows that depend on the position of the solution, plus 25 minutes on the shaded scale, which is the current time. The difference is 25 minutes because our standard time is set in Tokyo, Japan.
An accurate sundial
The red booth, which looks like a public telephone booth, has a certified seal on the East Coast Bicycle Road. In front of it is Jeongdongjin Beach, where sand fields spread out. In front of Jeongdongjin Station, Jeongdongjin 1-ri Beach and Jeongdongjin 2-ri Beach in front of Hourglass Park.
Jeongdongjin Viewed from the Sea
Sand and cool waves tickling your feet feel good. To the south of the beach is a large boat-shaped sun cruise resort on the hill.
Jeongdongjin beach with beautiful sea colors
Travel info

Recommended travel season: spring, summer, autumn

Recommended trip: lovers, family, friends

Related website address

traditional market


Okgye Oil Field
In the past, it was the largest oil market in southern Yeongdong, after North Sea Pyeongpyeong. At present, the number of visitors has been reduced so much that it only maintains the context, but it is still enough to feel the warmth and warmth of the oil field. The main focus is on healthy produce produced locally and fresh seafood from Jinjin Port and Dojik Port. Farming tools, seedlings, fried foods, and marketplace foods are assorted.

item.title: Early Spring Day, Relaxing Sea Walk Gangneung Yeongjin Beach - Gangneung, South Korea
item.description:
Yeongjin beach landscape

Early Spring Day, Relaxing Sea Walk Gangneung Yeongjin Beach

Gangneung, South Korea

The spring breeze drinks a cup of hot coffee on the beach. The harmony of the sea and coffee enhances the value of relaxation. In order to enjoy the early spring time, we leave for Gangneung, the city of sea and coffee. Instead of the bustle of Gangneung Port (Anmok Beach) cafe street, which is already well known, the destination is Yeongjin Beach, which is well-known for knowing. Enjoy a half-day stroll at Yeongjin Beach, a place where you can relax and enjoy the calm springtime.
Relaxing springtime beach with a cup of coffee
As is the case with Gangneung, there are more and more cafes on the beaches of Gangneung. In the old days, Gangneung Port Cafe Street was the center, and now you can find cafes on various beaches in Gangneung. Some prefer Gangneung Port Café Street, where many cafes are crowded, while others prefer quiet, quiet beachside cafes. Sacheonjin Beach and Yeongjin Beach are the places that many people with the latter taste find. If Gangneung Port Café Street is a big star, is Sacheonjin Beach and Yeongjin Beach an indie star with mania fans?
Yeongjin Beach is located between Jumunjin Port and Sacheonjin Port. It is also the place where 12 courses of Baugil from Sacheonjin Beach to Jumunjin pass. On the shore of Yeongjin Beach, you can see the tranquil Yeongjin Port on one side and the bustling Order Port on the other. Yeongjin Beach has wide sandy beaches, clean, and light blue. The water is even brighter on sunny spring days. The water is shallow and the water is clean, so the floor is clearly visible. It is good to walk the trilogy while enjoying the warm sun. Soft sand and gentle spring light tickle the mind. There aren't many people, so it's great to enjoy a relaxing walk in spring. Add a cup of warm coffee to the spring sea walk, which still feels cold.
Early Springtime, Yeongjin Beach Scenery
There are not many cafes on the beach of Yeongjin, which looks like a peaceful fishing village. But it is also a special place with the history of Gangneung Coffee. Gangneung is a pioneer in establishing the city of coffee and Bohemian, one of Gangneung's two great mountains, is located on a small hill near Yeongjin Beach. If you enter the village from the beach, you can taste savory coffee in Bohemian, which is run by Park Yi-chu, a master of coffee.
Early Springtime, Yeongjin Beach Scenery
In front of Yeongjin Beach is 'Cafe Brazil' which started its business in 2008. A modern two storey building catches the eye. In the early days, single-storey houses were remodeled and operated as cafes. I roasted fresh coffee every day, serving high quality coffee.
Cafe Brasil, a modern two-story building
In the fall of 2013, it was transformed into the same stylish two-story building. Both the 1st and 2nd floors are equipped with glass windows, so you can see the sea at a glance. There is also a large outdoor terrace on the ground floor.
Outdoor terrace with cafe brazil inside
As you enter the room on the first floor and order a cup of coffee, you'll notice the words on the wall. "Coffee is as black as the devil, as hot as hell, as pure as an angel, as sweet as love." Swallow a cup of hot and sweet coffee in your hand.
Outdoor terrace with cafe brazil inside
Cafe Brazil's main character is not just coffee. Cool sea views co-star. The same is true on the first floor, but on the second floor, a panoramic view of the ocean over the tall glass is spread out.
Attractive glass windows overlooking the sea
While walking on the beach and looking at the sea from the front, the sea is beautiful, but the sea overlooking from a high space is also fascinating. Sipping warm coffee and admiring the sea so that your eyes are cold. Where do you want to see this eye again?
Attractive glass windows overlooking the sea
Squid Bread and Homemade Burger on Yeongjin Beach
If you're unhappy with a cup of coffee, you can go to the marshmallow and squid bread shop on Yeongjin beach. After walking out of Café Brazil, you will see a small two-story building with the big word squid bread. This shop features specialty breads made with Jumunjin's famous squid.
A marshmallow and squid bread shop on Yeongjin beach
The word squid bread stimulates curiosity. How does squid bread taste? The size is small enough to fit in the palm of your hand. Small but with everything from fins to eyes and legs. It's not just appearance. Inside is a real ordered squid.
A marshmallow and squid bread shop on Yeongjin beach
If you think that the bread with red bean paste is 'there'll be there,' it is a miscalculation. Let's get rid of the preconception that squid and bread don't seem appropriate. Squid and bread create a harmonious taste. Contains squid powder and squid extract, as well as real squid. If you take a bite, savory squid and sweet bread taste at the same time. One by one, two go hand in hand.
Gentle squid bread with real squid
The second floor is decorated with a cafe, overlooking the sea, with squid bread and coffee or tea. There is also a squid bread experience where you can draw your own pictures on squid bread.
Gentle squid bread with real squid
If you still have some regrets to leave this sea, let's go get a meal. There is also a homemade burger shop on Yeongjin Beach that is emerging as a cafe these days. Winnie Burger is a 2-minute walk from Juicy and Squid Bread Shop towards Jumunjin. There are many local burgers in Gangneung because you can taste a variety of homemade burgers in a busy atmosphere.
A hearty homemade burger looking out to sea
More than 10 burgers are available, including the most basic Winnie Burger with thick patties and fresh vegetables, the unique Sweet Pine Burger made with Donut Burn instead of hamburger buns, Winnie Cajun Burger and BBQ Egg Burger. Among them are wine burgers with garlic wine sauce and mozzarella cheese burgers that flow like a waterfall. If you feel overwhelmed with cheese, you can choose a hot chili burger with a spicy flavor. Depending on your taste, you can add toppings such as mozzarella cheese, pineapple, patty, egg, and jalapeno.
A hearty homemade burger looking out to sea
Winnie Burger consists of a small first floor where ordering and cooking takes place and a spacious second floor with unobstructed sea views. Enjoying a burger while looking out the sea through a large window doubles the taste. On a warm spring day, you can sit on the outdoor terrace to take a break from the tickling sea breezes and the sound of the last wave.
Winnie Burger 2F View
Travel info

Yeongjin Beach
Address: 72-2, Yeongjin-ri, Yeonggok-myeon, Gangneung-si, Gangwon-do
Contact: 033-640-4534

item.title: The face talked, the story came out - Gwangju, Gyeonggi, South Korea
item.description:
Portraits of Japanese Military Comfort Women Victims

The face talked, the story came out

Gwangju, Gyeonggi, South Korea

The grandmothers of the Japanese comfort women history have nothing to say. Tell the past years with your face. The grandmothers in the paintings are deeply stacked with sad stories in fan folds. There are about 1000 faces on the face of the museum. Some faces seem to want something, while others seem to realize the uselessness of emotions over time. Seeds of time and woven faces of stories. He visits Gwangju, Gyeonggi-do to listen to the myriad faces.
The tears on her face have wrinkles
The fluffy white girls of the 1930s became gray-haired grandmothers in 2019. It has been 80 years since the victims of the Japanese comfort women. Of the 238 grandmothers who were registered with the government, only 22 survived. Their average age is in their 90s. There may not be much time left. We need a place where we can better remember our grandmothers. So good news. The Japanese military comfort women's museum in Gwangju, Gyeonggi-do was newly expanded.
“We must leave in history the work we did not overcome.” It was first opened in 1998 on the back of Grandmother Kim Hak-soon, the first to testify to the damage of the Japanese military 'comfort women'. Since then, in late 2017, a relic exhibition hall and memorial archives have been established. It is a memorial to the back of the sharing house, passing through the entrance where the girl's flower, which is a symbol of victims of the Japanese military 'comfort women', and the bust of grandmothers. It is a two storey building with tiled walls. The memorial building on the first floor is divided into three parts. There are grandmothers portraits in the exhibition hall, the relics of the grandmothers in the relics exhibition hall, and about 20 paintings painted by grandmothers in the paintings exhibition hall.
Grandmother bust of `` comfort women '' at the entrance of Japanese comfort women history museum
There are 10 paintings side by side that are more than 1 meter wide. It is a picture of grandmothers by performing artist Poppin Hyun-joon. He said. "I painted it again with the hope that my grandmother's face would not be forgotten." Every grandmother has a different look and mood. Grandmother Park Ok-ryon of the white hair shut firmly on the date of her mouth, and Bae Choon-hee raised her mouth as if smiling. Kim Gunja grandma soon said, "Did you eat?" It's playful eyes like I'm talking. Instead of opening up their mouths to explain themselves, grandmothers spend much of their lives with expressions of lines and colors. The girl's tears dried up and became her grandmother's wrinkles. The grandmothers in the painting closed their eyes without receiving official Japanese apology.
Portraits by Grandmother Poppin Hyun Joon
Older girls talked and painted
"I don't know why things are so vivid, even if I can't remember what's near."
Kim Soon-deok says. In the exhibition hall, there are seventeen grandmothers' life histories, photographs, and items they used during their lifetime. 'Live a life together' is the title of the exhibition. It was a life where there was something more lonely than something pleasant, something more than something to remember.
Exhibition of exhibits
"All of my friends are dead and I'm just living back."
11 years old, the youngest of the "comfort women" registered with the government. Grandma Kim returned home alone from Hokkaido, Japan. Kim Ok-joo was deceived by a Japanese landlord saying she had a job. The arrival was a comfort station in Hainan Island, China. Each story is long and long to abbreviate in just a few lines.
Relics Exhibition Hall
The things you used in your life are so simple. Magnifying glass, Hwatu, Hangul textbooks, passports that would hold 'Dandy' in hand . I was crying and angry, and I was slowing down as I calmed my heart.
Grandma's Rustic Keepsakes
There is still music in the picture exhibition. Seochon Alley, it seems that you entered a small gallery. Grandmothers have been painting since 1993. At first, I was drawing along things around me, but as time passed, I began to express the past.
A picture exhibition featuring over 20 paintings painted by grandmothers
Maybe fifteen? A girl in a white jacket is drawn to someone's arm. The wild flowers that bloomed in her homeland were so beautiful that she could not hear the girl's cry. Kim Soon-deok's <Attracting> vividly depicts the moment she was taken to the comfort woman.
Grandmother Kim Soon-duk's Work
Most of the girls in the paintings cover their faces with their hands, their eyes closed, or they have no expression.
Grandmother Kang Deok-gyeong's work
Yes. The only thing a girl could do in front of the Japanese soldiers waiting in line and waiting for one person to lie down.
Kang, Deok-Kyung's work <Penant Officer>

In the memorial hall, you can see the hand-printing of the victims, photos of 105 victims of domestic and foreign “comfort women” and a list of 280. It is the face of courageous accusers of Japanese war crimes. If you want to know more about the history of the Japanese military 'comfort women', you should also look around the existing history. The background of the establishment of the comfort women system, a record of activities on finding out facts, and a map showing the location of the Japanese military comfort station are arranged in detail. In the third exhibition space, there is a comfort station model with reference to victim testimony. The side room is 5 ~ 7㎡. I was upset at the moment, but I put up with it. Don't lose your composure and vow to see the historical truth.

Don't turn around. Don't forget to not forget even in the midst of your busy life. Face the pain of your current grandmother. The grandmothers in the painting are handing over.

Photos and lists of domestic and foreign victims of comfort women
Huge archive of faces
With a deep tingling feeling, he heads to the museum face to meet more diverse faces. Should it be like a junk or a loft that gathered all kinds of miscellaneous secrets? This is the first impression of the museum's face in Namjong-myeon, Gwangju, Gyeonggi-do. This museum is the first time. The exhibits are not organized by age or have friendly explanations. Faces sway across the times and regions. There is a picture of actor Audrey Hepburn next to the shamanism and James Dean next to the Buddha. The museum's face exhibits more than 1,000 facial sculptures, from photographs, paintings and portraits to masks, puppet and stone statues. It's a huge archive of faces. It has been collected by senior theater director Kim Jong-ok for over 50 years.
Inside view of museum face
The center of the first floor is empty. It's like a theater stage. It is the architectural intention of the director who thinks that the works of the museum are actors on the stage and wants to make a festival ground with the old people. There are colorful masks on the left wall and pictures of theatricians on the right wall. Traditional masks have a slightly different look just by the eye. Eyes that are raised uphill are biting impressions, and eyes that are gentle like downhill are sullen. Stone Buddha has nothing but a peaceful face. Actor James Dean is keen on something.
Various face sculptures including masks, sculptures
Unlike the first floor, which is a mix of East and West works, the second floor is rich in oriental colors. The exhibition focuses on bonuses and marionettes, especially the various marionettes.
Kiln to carry dead body to grave at traditional funeral, bonus
The puppet was decorated with bonuses at traditional funerals. A friend of the road that sees the souls of the dead. There is no saddening puppet. He is dressed in colorful clothes and smiles. 'Let me forget all the hardships of my life and have a good memory.' I pray for the paradise birth of the deceased.
Cheerful expression of puppet to accompany dead man's journey
“Don't frown, everything will be washed away”
The highlight of the museum's face is the stone gardeners in the outdoor garden. A stone man is a stone in the form of a man who was built at the entrance of a tomb or village. Jangseung acted as the patron saint of the village, and the gates and copper seats in front of the tombs honor the dead.
Stonemason in the outdoor garden
There is no one person like Seok-in brought from each province such as Jinju-si, Gyeongnam-do, Jindo-gun, Jeonnam, and Jeju-do. Some have a serene look, while others have round eyes. It usually wears off over time and winds down, making it hard to see. What did the mason look like when he pricked stones and breathed freshly? Imagine a face hundreds of years ago. An open mouthed stoner speaks. “Don't frown like that. Don't be so happy. Then everything is washed away. ” It is comfort that only those who endure for hundreds of years can do. Those who have passed through these long and long years teach without change.
Tianjin Innocent Face
When you enter the face of the museum, you may be confused about what to look for. The viewing method is simple. Keep an eye out for the disordered objects, and then look at them when you see a catchy face. Soon silence will be broken. A museum with thousands of faces is full of quiet turmoil.
There are many faces in Gwangju, Gyeonggi-do. Look carefully. To hear beyond what he does not say. So we dare to understand others. If 'expansion of awareness' is called travel, Gwangju is a good destination.
Stoneman showing the passage of time
