item.title: Seosan, Chungnam, South Korea - Dip your clams and make ecchi chocolate! 'Sea Village Diary' used at Seosan Village Village Village
item.description:
Junglipo-gu with a tidal flat

Dip your clams and make ecchi chocolate! 'Sea Village Diary' used at Seosan Village Village Village

Seosan, Chungnam, South Korea

Fresh spring has settled down at the Jung-ri Village Village, which is located along the wide tidal flats of Garorim Bay, Seosan-si, Chungnam. When the tidal-flats in front of Jungripo-gu reveal the locals, there are crowds of residents who came out of the clams and experienced visitors who held hands with their children.
From treasure hunts in a golden fishery to making crafts, strolling through the villages with springtime plains, and exploring Seosan Creative Art Village. Let's leave the family outing to the all-round beauty village.
Smiling children holding clams
Find it! Treasure hidden in the mud flats
Garorim Bay, surrounded by Seosan-si and Taean-gun, Chungnam, is one of the five largest tidal flats in the world. It is so clean that the sea is added to the forest with dew. Fresh seafood springs up like pollination in all seasons. Jungali Village Experience Village in Jigok-myeon, Seosan-si is famous for the Oeok-nakji Festival in Gaet Village in autumn. In March-May, the clam that has been plump for the season waits for Gilson. Thanks to the abundance of fishery resources, experiences, and unspoiled natural environment, we won the Grand Prize at the 2014 Fishing Village Advancement Competition.
Experiencers gathering for three or five
The experience time changes daily depending on the time of the day, so you should inquire in advance. If you look for a good day before and after the full moon, it can make the tidal flat experience easier.
Seasoned clams
At the Jungali Village Experience Village ticket office, which arrived on time, the booths were crowded with experienced visitors who changed their boots from early morning. As soon as the kids with the net and hoe got on the electric cart, they were excited. Jungripo-gu is an endless stretch of tidal flats. The children, who traveled around the tidal-flat of their feet, fall into a clam samgye with a hoe in their fern hands.
A scallop shell with a wish is hanging at the entrance of the village.
Pick a floor with a hole and scrape it with a hoe and the clams will come out as a bunch. Every time a clam comes out of the mud, the children who run into the river are ecstatic.
Electric cart moves from ticket office to tidal flat
The small shellfish is saved and the thick one is picked up in the net. However, the shellfish at this time is full of flavor even though it looks small. The clam filled with one net is about 2-3 kg. The time required for the experience is not set separately, but after a couple of hours, the tidal flats are filled with water. The experience fee is 10,000 won per person, including tools.
Children who clam with their hands
If you look for the time when the water comes in, you can try fishing on board. They are mainly caught, songme and flatfish. It is possible to get into the shallow water, catching ponies, mullets, crabs, shrimps, and other side nets in June when the water temperature starts to rise. After mid-May, octopus catching experiences await families. The bamboo primrose, a traditional primitive fishing method, is installed 20m long so that you can catch octopus by tumbling across the tidal flats.
Children who clam with their hands
Making sweet and bitter ecstasy chocolate
After the can, you can stop by the Fishermen's House in the village. The first floor food experience center is equipped with cooking utensils and tableware. You can wash freshly picked fresh clams clean and boil clam kalguksu or clam ramen. If you prepare vegetables and noodles in advance, you can enjoy simple meals with your children and enjoy more time.
Instant kalguksu boiled in fresh clam
Fishermen's Happiness Center also runs an experience program such as making taetae chocolate. Ecklonia is a rare seaweed that blooms only from December to April in a limited area of Seosan Garorim Bay. Picking is difficult, and the process of washing and drying by hand is also very expensive. It looks similar to Mae-sae-gi, but it is called 'sea vegetables of the sea' because of its stronger fragrance and excellent efficacy.
Make Ecklon Chocolate
feeling
Make Ecklon Chocolate
Walk through Sinmong Judo, Seosan Creative Art Village and Jungwang-ri Village
Pass the entrance to the experience village and follow the left hill to reach Seosan Creative Art Village. The unspoiled landscape of the village of Jungali Village leads to Jungwang-ri through the art village. Behind the vast landscape of Garorim Bay, the cozy village road is hidden. It's closer to a mountain village than a typical fishing village, so it's good to stroll around talking with your child.
Seosan Creative Art Village Exterior
The starting point of the walk is Seosan Creative Art Village. In 2009, it remodeled the Jungwang branch school of Buseong Elementary School, which was closed. Although it is named 'Simon Hwang Sukbong Modern Calligraphy Center', various art exhibitions are held every month in addition to calligraphy.
Hallway showroom
On the second and fourth Saturday of every month, paintings are held on plates and mugs. Paintings made with pottery pens can be grilled and taken directly to the kiln. The entrance fee to the museum and the experience fee are both free and the experience must be booked in advance.
Pottery works made by experienced visitors
Also worth seeing is the front yard of the museum, where soot and sailboats are located. Standing on the front yard observatory, the Everspring Plain and Jungwang-ri Village look like picturesque. The spring plain, which is also a migratory habitat, means 'to see all the time'. The scenery is varied throughout the four seasons.
Cutely decorated front yard
Follow the steps of the observatory to take a stroll in Jungwang-ri Village. Jungwang-ri is a small village where 140 households live in tight densities. Wall paintings and installations follow the concept of 'Walking through the Shinmong Judo Garden'. Seosan Jigok-myeon, where Jungwang-ri is located, is known as the hometown of the Korean electric painter, who drew the Mont Yudo Island. If <Mondedo Island> was the dream of Anpyeongdae, the landscapes of Jigok-myeon with only the landscape would not affect the style of the dog.
Jungang-ri Village Landscape
Walking from Seosan Creative Art Village to Jungang 1-ri Village Hall, you will find witty genre paintings, cute murals, old mills still in operation, and farm equipment warehouses. Roads embroidered with pale pink flowers and small landscapes caught in the square frame of the village signage add to the taste of walking.
Information signs that go well with the town
After the road maintenance is completed, a program will be conducted in June to explore the village by electric carts at the Village Village Village.
The murals painted everywhere are humorous.

item.title: Jeju, South Korea - Enjoy Jeju's hidden specialties and local chicken dishes! Local Chicken Distribution Zone of Gyorae Village
item.description:
Traditional chicken Shabu Shabu cuisine at Gyorae Village

Enjoy Jeju's hidden specialties and local chicken dishes! Local Chicken Distribution Zone of Gyorae Village

Jeju, South Korea

Chicken is a common food that can be found anywhere in the country, but in Jeju, the chicken is a delicious delicacy. This is a place where you can taste various pure chickens, which are grown with fresh air from Hallasan, with shabu shabu, white soy sauce, and kalguksu. In Kyorae-ri, Jocheon-eup, which is designated as a special chicken distribution zone of Jeju Island, let's regain the taste that was lost in summer. Your meal and your body will be healthy.
Do you know the local chicken village of Gyoraeri?
Gyoraeri, located in the middle of the eastern part of Jeju, is famous for its local chicken village. Bijarim is located across the village, lined with local chicken restaurants. From chicken stir-fried chicken to white dishes and chicken kalguksu, as well as special menus such as chicken shabu-shabu, chicken enthusiasts can't overlook them.
Gyorae-ri became known as the Indigenous Chicken Village since the late 1970s. Located in the highlands of 400m above sea level, Gyoraeri is a rocky Gotjawal terrain and cold and snowy. Hunting and breeding have been developed instead of farming since ancient times. Although the village was ruined by 4.3 incidents around 1950, it gradually recovered and began to be called the local chicken village as the number of domestic chicken breeding farms increased in the late 1970s.
Since then, roads have been expanded through the villages, and tourist facilities have been built nearby, creating a specialty restaurant using local chicken, a local specialty. It's a local chicken restaurant street. In 2009, it was designated as a local chicken distribution zone in Jeju Island and continues the reputation of Korean chicken villages.
Gyorae-ri, Jocheon-eup designated as a local chicken distribution zone
The secret of the local chicken dish is fresh ingredients
Drinking fresh air from Hallasan and playing in green grassland, Gyoraeri chicken is definitely different in size and chewy compared to other chickens. Your muscles develop, so you don't need extra fat and you're full. Above all, native chicken is freshness. The reason why the local chicken dishes are delicious is because they eat the live chicken instead of frozen chicken.
There are also homes where local chickens are raised, but most have small farms on one side of the restaurant and sometimes take chickens from poultry farms. Some restaurants prepare daily meals in the morning and cook them immediately after ordering. It's all about getting fresh ingredients. Even if the recipes or seasonings are slightly different from house to house, the fresh ingredients are used first of all, so the basics are wherever you go.
Gyorae-ri chicken with fresh ingredients
Chicken Shabu Shabu
In addition to general chicken dishes such as fried chicken and chicken soup, we recommend Chicken Shabu Shabu as a special menu. Thinly sliced chicken breast is slightly boiled in chicken bone broth and tastes delicious.
Temper Garden, famous for chicken shabu shabu
If you want to taste chicken Shabu Shabu, you can find 'Taste Garden'. It is a local restaurant that attracts tourists as well as residents. Chicken shabu-shabu, white rice, and green beans are served in turn like a course meal.
Slice the plate full of chicken breast
Chicken breasts are usually unpopular because of their rich texture. Vegetables such as cabbage, green onions, and mushrooms are mixed and soaked in sour sauce. The light taste of chicken breast is the same, but you can feel it with a thin texture. The chicken dung house and the skin that comes with it go without any refusal. The hot broth from the oil is easy to eat with a simple taste.
Slightly boil chicken breasts marinated in chicken bones
By the time she eats all the shabu shabu, the steaming steam is on the table. Once you're impressed by the amount of food you've filled, you'll be impressed by the chewy taste. Mung bean sprinkled like a sauce adds a delicious flavor to the simmered white meat. Chickens are so big that one chicken leg is a child's forearm.
It is delicious when we dip in sauce with cooked vegetables
The lean lean meat goes well without having to chew several times. Every bite bite sticks in your mouth, so it tastes more delicious. If you have a preconception that local chickens are chewy, throw them away at home. The chewy but smooth chewy texture is very satisfying.
Chicken thighs are big and taste good
By the time the dish is emptied, the mung bean is boiled with chicken broth. Chicken porridge with rich green bean flavor is a delicacy. Mung beans that pop in the mouth add to the taste of chewing.
Mung bean made with thick green beans in chicken broth
Light but firm meal, chicken kalguksu
If you are traveling alone or want to taste a local chicken with a light meal, Chicken Noodle Soup is a great choice. There are several houses serving chicken kalguksu, but Gyorae Son Kalguksu and Gotjawal Son Kalguksu are popular. The chicken is put in abundantly according to the name of chicken kalguksu.
Gyorae hand kalguksu, known for its delicious chicken noodle soup
Gyorae hand kalguksu is famous for its fresh noodles. It takes some time for the food to come out because the noodles are pulled out with the order, but the chewy noodles are good. The thick, juicy broth is like a healthy food. It's quite hungry even if I just eat chicken. At lunchtime, it's crowded with guests enough to wait for a few minutes, so it's better to skip the meal.
It's chewy because it's freshly picked
Gotjawal Son Kalguksu also serves chicken and various vegetables. It has a lot of vegetables such as pumpkin, potatoes and onions so the aftertaste is lighter and clearer.
Gotjawal Sonkal Noodles, a hidden restaurant
A generous amount of chicken also has a good texture. Kimchi, kakdugi, and pickles that are served as a side dish add a fresh taste.
Good compatibility with soft chicken and crispy bean sprouts
Gyorae Village has many places to visit as a clean area with natural environment. Fill your stomach and enjoy the rest of your journey.
Jeju Dol Culture Park where you can meet unique Jeju stones
Gyorae Natural Recreation Forest and neighboring Jeju Stone Culture Park is a place where you can experience Jeju's unique stone and living culture. The site is so large that it is a good idea to take your time and enjoy yourself.
Jeju Stone Park Promenade

item.title: Bucheon, South Korea - 냠냠 Bucheon Center, Children's Food Safety Experience Center, Gyeonggi-do
item.description:
냠냠 Bucheon Center, Children's Food Safety Experience Center, Gyeonggi-do

냠냠 Bucheon Center, Children's Food Safety Experience Center, Gyeonggi-do

Bucheon, South Korea

Candy, ramen, soda… . Why do children prefer to be harmful? If you want to change the eating habits of your child who likes sweet and stimulating food, visit the Bucheon Center for Children's Food Safety Experience Center in Gyeonggi-do. As you enjoy the game, you will learn about nutrition, proper eating habits, and food hygiene. One visit won't change your eating habits, but it's enough to create a momentum for you.

Experience-like Content

냠냠 Gyeonggi-do Children's Food Safety Experience Center (hereinafter referred to as the Food Safety Experience Center) is a place where infants and elementary school children can have fun and learn healthy eating habits. The space is small enough for everyone to experience in one to two hours, but the contents are clear for its size.

Food Safety Experience Center
Open the door and you'll notice a photo zone with a large sandwich bed and cracker table. As you pass the photo zone, a trimman with a long nose, like Pinocchio, looks down at the visitor. It looks like you're sucking on a soda can with a straw, and you can press a button in the middle of the can to trim it. While eating, the air swallowed together flows back into the esophagus. The soda contains a large amount of carbon dioxide, which results in undigested gas. It's easy to feel good at digestion, but it doesn't really help.
Photo zone for commemorative photos lying on a sandwich bed
Behind the trimman, there are several farting chairs that sound ‘Pooh’. Even though it makes a sound without smell, the children hold the nose and sit down and stand and have fun. If you endure farts, they may be absorbed into the blood or pee. However, if you put up with it too long, your stomach will get sore and your stomach will not be able to digest.
The fart sounds are fun.
In the case of individual viewing, visitors can freely tour the facilities in the experience hall. Video viewing and strawberry milk making experiments will be held together with the children. The video, Secrets in the Refrigerator, shows the dangers of spoiled food and the importance of healthy ingredients.
Videos to learn about food hygiene
After watching the video, the experiment of making strawberry milk begins. There are white milk and coloring on the table where children sit together. Add a few drops of pink to white milk, a few drops of strawberry-flavored additives, and sugar to mix the sweet strawberry milk that kids love. Strawberry milk or banana milk does not contain strawberries or bananas, but rather is an experiment that tells you that a lot of food additives and sugar. Almost all processed foods contain various food additives such as pigments, preservatives and coagulants. Food additives can cause allergies, diarrhea and vomiting and increase the risk of scary diseases such as anemia, cancer and hepatitis. Avoid processed foods that contain food additives, such as white milk rather than strawberry or banana milk, and fish rather than crab meat.
Strawberry milk has no strawberries ~
Next to the experiment table is a game called 'Catch the Color Man.' When a lot of coloring ice cream, candy, sweets, etc. appear on the screen, throw a small pocket to play. The children threw their pockets, shouting “Ice cream, don't eat!”, “Candy, go away!”. You can't really know how long you're going to go home, but this time is true.
Throw your pocket and catch the sax man ~
No junk food, no!
The children are busy laughing when they enter the corner of our digestion story. This is because the whole body comes out on the screen and the stomach, small intestine, large intestine, and anal images are shown in the body, showing how the food is digested and taken into the poop. It's fun to squat and take a poop. Next to it is the 'Mysterious Table' where you learn balanced eating habits. Among the foods that appear on the screen, you can select the foods that fit your mission and put them on the plate.
Smart Mart and Bad Mart show children's favorite high-calorie, low-nutrition and junk food. First, the smart mart picks one of the baskets on the display and puts it on a plate. It is a formula that shows the ingredients of foods by taking a lot of foods such as excessive sodium such as cup ramen, high-fat foods such as hamburgers, and processed beverages containing a large amount of food additives. In addition, 'Knowing the amount of salt' in Jajangmyeon, Kalguksu, Naengmyeon, and Ramen etc. .
Smart Mart to inform nutrition
If you look at the junk foods provided in the bad mart on the camera, the coloring man and bacteria man appears to show the problems of each food. You can look for foods that are past their expiration date, have been added with unacceptable pigments, or have been unsanitarily cooked in bad food.
Bad Mart to find bad food
You'll also find Cocomong's healthy gym corner, your exact height and weight, atopy OX quiz game, a microscopic view of the bacteria that cause food poisoning, and a hand-washing experience corner that teaches you how to properly wash your hands. The sneeze nostrils, a space for understanding rhinitis, are especially popular with children because they shoot a small ball into the nostrils.
Wash your hands to make sure you wash well
If you are a child who doesn't like eggplants or mushrooms, make sure to experience the `` wall of overcoming dermatitis. '' Rather than nagging you to eat vegetables and fruits steadily for healthy skin, you'll remember the importance of stepping up the vegetables at this corner. 'Health Avatar' is also a game-type experience. Avatars who follow their gestures choose snacks, and if they choose pizza, burgers, and soda, they get fat, and if they choose vegetables, fruits, or milk, they get stronger.
“Walls for overcoming dermatitis” decorated with artificial rocks
There is a farming experience garden and an animal cage outside. From spring to autumn, you can plant, grow, and harvest 20 kinds of vegetables such as pumpkin, eggplant, paprika, tomatoes, lettuce, and potatoes. In chicken and rabbit farms next to the garden, they may feed or observe movement.
Farming experience garden where you can grow various vegetables
The Cactus Greenhouse and the Climate Change Experience Center in the Resource Circulation Center are opposite the Food Safety Experience Center. In addition to Bucheon-si, Osan-si has a children's food safety experience center.
If you're a weekday, take a look at the climate change

item.title: Pocheon, South Korea - The Miniature African Continent, The Park African Museum
item.description:
Entrance of The Park African Museum

The Miniature African Continent, The Park African Museum

Pocheon, South Korea

“Good artists copy, great artists steal.” Picasso's quote is that he calls himself the “king of the arts.” As he said, Cubists, including Matisse and Brac, completed his distinctive expressionist art, inspired by African sculptures. Come see the African art that stole the hearts of genius artists and the continent of inspiration.
Where the sun is chosen, Africa
Africa, which means “the sun shines well” in Latin, is literally a continent full of passion under the abundant sun. Africa is home to a brilliant civilization. You can see the people living there breathing with nature at The Park African Museum (African Museum).
The African Museum was first opened in 2006 to promote cultural exchanges with African countries. Take a slow stroll through the gardens and face the entrance to the museum, where you can experience African culture.
Sloping Road to the Museum
Before entering the museum, if you are interested in sculptures, look closely at the shows and sculptures surrounding the garden. Showa sculpture, the essence of African stone culture, is a modern sculpture that began to develop around Zimbabwe's sculptural community in the 1950s. It is a highly difficult piece made by hand, using only traditional tools such as chisels and hammers, while maintaining the original shape to instill a spirit into the stone. It is recognized as a work of art so long as there is a saying that 'if there are 10 leading sculptors leading the world, at least five will be Shona sculptures'.
African sculptures decorating the museum
Rediscovering Africa
The African Museum shows you not only the culture and art of Africa but also the lives and lives of Africans. When I enter the museum exhibition room, I am shocked by the soft and rhythmic African melody.
The first-floor art shop, as well as the exhibition hall is full of interesting things
1 In the exhibition room, you can meet about 100 relics related to culture such as patriarchs, native beliefs and hunting, as well as folk music and musical instruments. It seems to be armed with intense clunky, but each one is delicate and mysterious.
1 The entrance of the exhibition hall and the chairs used by the tribal chiefs are cool
In the 2nd Exhibition Hall, where you can have a glimpse into the life and life culture of Africans, you can understand various African rituals that we cannot encounter through life.
The second floor where African native paintings are displayed
For Africans, consciousness is very important because it is an important process to formulate individual change. From birth, he is recognized by his community through rituals at important times such as the ceremony, wedding, funeral, and ritual.
Mystical sculptures found in the craft showroom
If you think that the viewing is over by looking around the exhibition room, it is Osan. There is literally a special meeting in the special exhibition room. Wild animals that have been restored vividly to every hair with their craftsmanship welcome us.
African ornaments that are likely to be fashionable
The popular animals of the World Animal Expedition Expo, which have been conducted over the past two years, have been gathered together and dressed as a theme for each character. As if the tiger in the movie 'Life of Pie' jumps at me, he is proud of the big size, and the polar bear on the glacier smiles with his chubby paws.
Restoration animals to meet in the special exhibition room
Let's relax at the performance hall in front of the museum. A local cultural troupe in Africa, a lively cultural heritage, will perform lively and rhythmic dances along with live music to match traditional percussion instruments such as djembe. African dance is the basis of exciting dances such as mambo, twist, and disco that have been popular all over the world.
Restoration animals to meet in the special exhibition room
If you're really excited, go upstage and shake it together. You can learn African dance properly. After the show, you will be given photo time, which is a good way to leave visible memories. However, because the performance is held twice a day, it is essential to check the time.
Carp pond. Take a stroll and enjoy the autumn mood
After the show, if you can afford it, take a quick stroll through the park. Colorfully colored leaves, we realize that this is Korea, not Africa. Why don't you fall in love with Africa with beautiful promenades during the season of travel?
State of beautifully colored autumn leaves

item.title: Icheon, South Korea - I live with rice! Restoration in a bowl of “King's King Icheon Rice”
item.description:
Glutinous Icheon stone rice with rice

I live with rice! Restoration in a bowl of “King's King Icheon Rice”

Icheon, South Korea

Passing through Chobok and entering the center of the heat, now is the season when you need to take care of yourself. At this time, we use summer chicken with eel or chicken. Based on the style of Lee Yeol-chi-yeol introduced earlier, cool cold noodles, plural nights, and red bean shaved ice are added as summer delicacies. It's a hot season full of various styles of food, but no matter what anyone says, Koreans live with 'bapsim'. So prepared. From the old days, the rice paddy town that has caught on to the king's appetite.
Our Korean food divided into stocks and corrosion. Most Asian regions, including South Korea and neighboring China and Japan, are rice cultures that are cooked with rice and side dishes. In Western cultures where bread is eaten, wheat is replaced by rice. We need water to build our staple rice crop. This is why 'irrigation' is needed to water farmland. This required a large number of labor forces and farmers gathered around the waterways to induce community life. This characteristic of the Asian region, which shows cooperation and interdependence, emerges from the stock 'rice farming'. On the other hand, wheat, which grows on bare ground without irrigation, reveals the characteristics of the Western world, which have a strong personal and independent character.
How much have you tasted?
My parents say that they eat “white meat with meat soup” only a few times a year. It means that precious. Now that the world is better, rice consumption has decreased as food is overflowing. However, in the 1970s, when mass production of rice became possible, many wished to eat a single rice.
Hancheon at Deokje Palace, a restaurant specializing in Icheon rice
It is a difficult time for us to imagine that lunches and white kimbap with white rice are easily available at convenience stores.
Appetizers served when you order rice meal
Like this, rice is a staple food that we eat three times a day. What is so special about Icheon rice, which is said to have been won by King Surat, among the “rices” everyone eats every day? Icheon rice is growing despite the decrease in rice production nationwide. To taste his charm, headed to Chungchungdae.
Appetizers served when you order rice meal
Gap Street, Icheon Gyeongchung-daero
The road leading to Icheon by way of National Highway No. 3 is followed by restaurants that announce “Icheon Rice Restaurant”. Many famous rice shops, such as Deokje Palace, Icheon Rice Restaurant, and King's Rice Restaurant, are quite popular on weekends and weekdays. When ordered, Icheon rice, which was suggested to the king, is put in a stone-cooker and cooked. Other grains other than rice are white rice. Sometimes black beans enter the house. Like other nutritious rice, the jujube, chestnut, pine nuts, etc. are made only with rice, but the shiny rice itself is sweet and sweet. What side dishes would not be enough to greasy and delicious rice. Precious side dishes are added to this, so it's better to loosen the belt for a while.
How about the sweet rice you eat every day? The rice itself seems to taste the dishes. Asked the owner of Icheon's rice bakery, he chose "large daylight when the sun is abundant and the rice ripens" and "a land rich in nutrients mixed with clay and sand." It would mean that the rice has the optimal natural environment to grow. Since ancient times, this is why rice was chosen as a true beauty. What is important is that Icheon Rice's reputation is not just an old story.
Icheon rice street where Icheon rice specialty shops gather
The wage table Icheon rice, familiar to us, was the first rice in Korea to be attached with the wage table in the mid-1990s. The history of Icheon rice, which was on the top of the king's surat statue, is preserved as it is, and the revolutionary work was made to increase the reputation of Icheon rice.
“With the“ Mika ”boom, the leisure life of our people began in earnest. What's the most important thing to play around? Isn't the Geumgang mountain after dinner? As more and more people went to and from the Seoul metropolitan area, one or two restaurants started to be built on Icheon side. At first, we put our side dishes on rice, and as people gathered and restaurants increased, we now have a huge table. ”
Panoramic view of Deokje Palace built with Hanok style
Sweet or sweet! Greasy, white rice
Let's go try the Icheon rice meal. If you go to a restaurant specializing in Icheon rice, there are two or three set meals. There is a slight price difference, and the cheapest meals are prepared from 10,000 won to 30,000 won.
Icheon rice cooker Icheon stone-cooked rice
There is a slight price difference between restaurants, but no big difference. Appetizers such as porridge, jeon, salad, jelly, and chopped vegetables are similar. There are one or two differences in the main menu such as grilled eel, cutlet stew, gujeolpan, steamed ribs, soy crab, samhab, and smelt sashimi. Still, it is the same that Icheon Dolsot Rice is included in all price ranges.
Hansang
If you have a particular favorite side dish, you can also add a la carte to the cheapest meal. Most restaurants can be ordered from two or more people
Soy crab, one of the main menus
Dolsol rice is tasted according to taste. For those who want to enjoy the rice hot, you can enjoy it while you put it in a stone bowl and enjoy it.
LA ribs
It's only summer left to get hot. If you are tired of the rainy season and the typhoon that blows through the heat, why don't you go for a “bapsim”?
Noodles, the delicacy of stone rice
The energy of the tiger rises in a bowl of warm white rice. Whoever said that, Koreans are living with 'bapsim'.
One croaker rice in white rice
When you're done eating, stop by Sulbong Park, a 15-minute drive away. How about extinguishing while walking through Seolbong Park Lake? You may add cultural life at Woljeon Museum of Art.
Seolbong Park near Icheon Rice Street
Oh, if you know Icheon, the rice district, let's know the rice culture festival that takes place every year. This year, the festival will be held in Seolbong Park for five days from October 21 to 25. Not only rice, but also various attractions such as Namdang Playa and Madang Theater. For some reason, don't forget to eat a bowl of Icheon rice!
Icheon Museum of Art, Woljeon, Korea

item.title: Suyeong-gu, Busan, South Korea - Feast of confession hotter than fireworks, Busan Fireworks Festival
item.description:
A scene from the Busan Fireworks Festival

Feast of confession hotter than fireworks, Busan Fireworks Festival

Suyeong-gu, Busan, South Korea

To leave memories that will last a lifetime, everyone will dream of a trip. There is a festival where you can add your confession to your loved one. Opportunity to communicate the heart with fireworks against the background of moist night sea and sweet music. I want to love you. Let's go to Busan night sea where Busan Fireworks Festival is held every year.
Confession of love delivered by fireworks

In October, the Busan Fireworks Festival is held every year. This year, two days from October 23, the theme of `` The beginning of love is confession '' was unchanged, and the city of Busan Gwangalli was brilliantly embroidered. However, we have prepared a much richer composition and various programs than before, and above all, we changed the way of directing the fireworks and greatly expanded the space of the fireworks show.

The fireworks show, the center of the festival, has become more colorful and has made the hearts of the viewers more chewy. First of all, he invited the world's best overseas flame team to be enthralled. In addition, the way the fireworks were produced has not changed much over the past 10 years. Unlike the previous one, which was held for 50 minutes under one theme, it took a 5-minute break after the 15-minute invitational fireworks show, and increased the concentration by directing it to the melody that suits the theme 'The beginning of love is confession' for 35 minutes.

During the five-minute break, special events caught the attention of the people. To commemorate the 50th anniversary of the normalization of Korean-Japanese relations, a fire broke out on the Tsushima Island closest to us beyond the Korea Strait.
The fireworks you see in person are even more impressive.
The stage, which is bigger than ever, was also noticed. This year, Busan Fireworks Festival is the largest in history. Considering that visitors were unable to watch properly due to the concentration of visitors, the stage of the '-' shape, which was spread around Gwangan Bridge, was expanded to the shape of a 'U' band after Dongbaek Island, Gwangalli and Igidae. As a result, the stage production was also changed, so the fireworks were much richer than before.
The fireworks you see in person are even more impressive.
Cultural arts, street performances and eve events are also abundant.
The Busan Fireworks Festival was only one day on the 24th, but on the 23rd, the day before, it was no less enjoyable. The biggest change is the eve concert. Last year's eve concert was held at Gwangalli Beach at 7:00 pm on the 23rd, which had nothing to do with the fireworks festival. Kim Beom-soo, Kim Tae-woo, Park Ji-min, Bernard Park, Son Seung-yeon, Jeong Dong-ha, Ali, and other singers gave me a more powerful stage than the fireworks. After the last night's concert, a 15-minute “overnight fireworks show” was held to inspire the festival.
Citizens enjoying the Busan Fireworks Festival
On the day of the festival, abundant sights were waiting for us. In addition to occupying good seats, young artists performed street performances from 2:00 pm for those who gathered from early times because they missed expectations.
Street performance attracting people's attention
Various events were spread along the Gwangalli Beach such as bands, dancing, percussion, and DJing to enjoy the event until 8 o'clock when the fireworks festival began.
Street performance attracting people's attention
The fireworks festival is over, but there are ways to enjoy the afterglow. The winning work of the Busan Fireworks Festival, which was held to become a festival with citizens, is on display at the Suyeong Riverside Special Exhibition Hall on the 31st under the theme of "Harmony of Light and Softening."
Street performances for both men and women

item.title: Jecheon, Chungbuk, South Korea - One-Day Trip to the Jecheon Scenic Tour Village, a City of Natural Healing
item.description:
Wood Train Remodeled

One-Day Trip to the Jecheon Scenic Tour Village, a City of Natural Healing

Jecheon, Chungbuk, South Korea

Tourism Tour is a new type of community-led tourism management community project where local residents become owners and voluntarily run tourism projects to create jobs and profits. In 2013, five areas including Yangpyeong, Gyeonggi-do, Yang-gu, Gangwon-do, Jecheon, Chungbuk, Cheongsong, and Jeonbuk, Buan were selected for the pilot project and supported by the Ministry of Culture, Tourism and Sports. Of these five, we will visit the “Tourism Village” in Jecheon, Chungbuk, which is actively operated due to the characteristics of the region.
The Jecheon Sightseeing Tour Village Tour Course consists of three tour village projects and a program that combines tourist attractions located nearby. In order to transform Jecheon's hidden treasures, Gyodong folk painting villages and republic villages into tourist destinations, the “Own Culture and Arts Cooperative” was launched. The Folk Painting Institute in Minhwa Village has developed a variety of murals, experiences, and souvenirs based on folk paintings. The former school, Gongjeon School, offers a variety of enzyme experiences and enzyme meals that are responsible for family health. 'History of History', which is not used at present, is being revived as a 'woodtrain' woodcarving workshop.
Gyodong Folk Painting Village, where we meet beautiful and humorous folk paintings through murals
Gyo-dong, where Gyo-dong Folk Painting Village is located, was a dwelling complex in the form of urban and rural complexes since the 1960s, when Korea's industrialization began.However, empty houses have begun to increase in recent years. From the beginning of drawing folk paintings, it is transformed into a folk painting village.
Jangseung Mural in Gyodong Folk Painting Village
Most of the single-storey houses have folk paintings such as tigers and deer, as well as innocent children, who have begun to decorate the walls of Kyodong.
Dragonfly and flower mural
The mural of Kyodong Folk Painting Village is different from the murals of other regions, and the theme of the mural is ‘어변성룡’.
Tiger mural
This word, which means “fish turns into a dragon,” symbolizes passing or success, so I think it's a good place for parents with children.
Fantastic harmony of flowers and murals

Jieun-soon Minhwa Research Institute, which serves as the starting point for Gyodong Folk Painting Village, runs various experience-based event programs, such as drawing folk paintings, making “Eomseong Sungryong” lucky bags using folk paintings, and making folk painting fan. In addition, you can listen to various stories related to folk paintings, and drawing folk paintings using traditional paints provides fun memories for both children and adults.

Eun-Soon Ji Minhwa Debt

In Gyodong Folk Village there is Gyodong Hyanggyo. Gyodong Hyanggyo was established in the year of King Gongyang, the last king of Goryeo, and was designated as Local Tangible Cultural Property 105. It is also a demonstration yangkyo designated by miners of cultural gymnasium.

Abyssal Dragon Lucky Bag
Public electronic junior high school, a place to experience and learn about nature

The “Own Art and Culture Cooperative” is a kind of collaboration made by 15 artists from Jecheon. Other majors, such as literature, photography, ceramics, woodwork, and art, are being utilized and the ones that are lacking are working together to prepare a foundation for independence in various fields such as culture, tourism and hands-on education.

The closed school 'Gongjeon Elementary School' and the closed area 'Gongjeon Station' have been refurbished to operate the 'Gongjeon Elementary School' centered on enzymes, and the 'Woodtrain' where you can experience woodworking with cypress wood. 'Gong-jeon Institute' is famous for various enzyme experiences such as Omija, Ogapi fruit plum, and herbal medicine, and natural enzyme dishes with side dishes.
GongYeon School Cafe
'Gongjeon Junior High School' is located in Gongjeon Elementary School, Gongjeon-ri, Bongyang-eup, Jecheon-si. Gongjeon Elementary School, once a large school with more than 2,000 students, was closed in 1999 due to the agricultural phenomenon.
Public electronics school signs
In recognition of this, Ahn Myung-sook has been rented from Jecheon Office of Education and Support since 2013, and has opened a new door to the “Public Electron School”.
Herbal tea tasting
One of the most popular programs of the public engineering school is the enzyme making experience using seasonal fruits.
Apple enzyme making
Green apples grown organically on the farm are used to make enzymes. Four apples are cut into 18 pieces, seeded well, put in a gourd, put sugar on top and mixed together for a long time. Mix until the sugar has melted and mixed in the apple juice. After tossing it, put it in a glass jar and pour sugar back to the top to cover the apples.
Completed Apple Enzyme
The real attraction here is the natural enzyme meal table. We carefully prepare freshly grown vegetables and enzyme natural meal using enzyme. More than a dozen side dishes add boiled pork. The most important part of a natural enzyme meal is that it comes with a colander of organic vegetables grown by hand. The clear insect streaks on the leaves of the vegetables are proof that they are organic, free of pesticides.
Enzyme side dish
The rice is not mixed with white rice, but with brown rice, chew more than 30 times, and the sweetness comes out on its own. Like all natural enzymes, the salinity of all side dishes is low. So you eat more side dishes than rice. Flour brown rice with organic rice and a spoonful of organic ssamjang with a spoonful of honey.
Grain rice
Wood-Train Wood Works, where you can make everything you need for everyday life

In 'Gongjeon Station', there is a 'Wood Train' run by Kim Kwang-ki. It is a space that produces and displays props that can be used in real life such as props, toys, name initials, pencil holders, etc.

Woodtrain Signs

The café displays a variety of woodwork and jigsaw art pieces that can be used in real life. The most eye-catching is a portrait of a former president made of jigsaw craft on a birch drawing board, hanging over the main entrance of the station. The outdoor carpentry experience room has a space where up to 50 people can experience woodworking. The representative experience program is to make pencil case and letter case using cypress. Pencil cases and letterboxes made from sandpaper, nailed, and carpentry glued to the sticky parts of the cypress cut into various shapes are popular experience programs that preschool children can complete in an hour.

Woodtrain Cafe Exhibit
The station was opened in 1959 and was used by more than 100,000 passengers per year by the end of the 1970s. However, since late 2008, there were no vehicles left without passengers. However, in 2012, Kwang-gi Kim, a woodworking artist, rented history from the Korean Railroad and was reborn as a woodcraft experience space called 'Woodtrain'. The station waiting room, the space where people waited to come and go, was made into a cafe space where you can experience woodworking and drink tea.
Presidential Jigsaw Craft
There are many things to see around the station. Yoo In-seok, a teacher of Sungjae Yoo-jung, raised a medical school to save his country and saved the country. There is Jinso Cheon Railway, famous for the filming of the starring Mint Candy. Woodtrain recently aired as a filming location for its popular program, "1 Night and 2 Days."
Cypress pencil case made by participants of the experience program
Travel info

item.title: Blossoming ponds and natural forest outings, Jeju Sunchulban Pond and Dongbaekdongsan Forest Trail
item.description:
Small and small Sunhull Pond, located on the street

Blossoming ponds and natural forest outings, Jeju Sunchulban Pond and Dongbaekdongsan Forest Trail

Jeju, South Korea

This is a mountain road leading to the entrance of Sunhul Village. At first glance a bunch of flowers passes by. I just missed it and pulled over. On a small pond adjacent to the road, there are plenty of water lilies. The water lilies are just beginning to bloom and open up their pink petals. The late spring is sent off with a simple yet bright smile.
Secret pond full of blooming flowers
Sunhul Village is located in the middle mountainous area of northeast Jeju. There is a small and small pond where only acquaintances visit. This is a village pond called Seonbanban Pond. If you don't pay attention to it, it's easy to pass by.
In late spring, when the early heat begins to come in, the Sunbahn Pond is filled with water lilies. It begins to bloom one by one in early May, and by mid-day, the pond is colored pink. Blooming petals among green round leaves remind us of pure and pure children.
A bunch of water lily flowers blooming over the pond
The water lily flower that rises above the dark blue water resembles the lotus that blooms in the mud. Resistant to the environment they are in, each one is like a beautiful flower, and the appearance is similar. If the water lily and lotus are a bit confusing, look closely at the leaf shape. Water lilies have flat leaves attached to the surface of water, and one side is deeply split, while lotus flowers have rounded leaves floating on the surface, as if an umbrella was opened. Dropping water on a lotus leaf rolls around without infiltrating or getting wet.
Another water lily that looks like a lotus
The water lily flower that blooms in the sun-dried pond in Jeju's soil is hard to see. Thanks to this, Sunbahn Pond never stops.
I bridge across the pond
People who hold the camera to capture the water lily flowers and those who go out in the late spring outing will take a rest while enjoying the water lily flowers. Cross the bridge across the pond and take a souvenir picture, or slowly stroll around the pond to enjoy a relaxing afternoon. Seon-Ban-Bang-Mok, with its secluded surroundings, is a good place to visit even for travelers who visit Jeju.
Sunbahn Pond Scenery
Camellia Garden designated as Ramsar Wetland
On the other side of the line, there is a forest named Camellia Garden because many camellia trees grow. The forest was once the home of the people. Camellia oil was obtained from the forest and the trees were felled and charcoal burned. Through this, children were raised and villages were built. The forest that gave generously what he had. The Camellia Garden, which was a living place for the residents, was designated as Ramsar Wetland in 2011 and is now being taken care of by people.
Dongbaekdongsan Forest Trail Entrance
Ramsar wetlands are the designation and protection of wetlands that are worth preserving globally through international agreements. In Jeju, four sites were registered as Ramsar Wetland, Sunli-dong Dongbaekdong, Aqua Youngorim, Water Park Orion, and Hill 1100. The village of Sunhull 1-ri, where Dongbaek Garden is located, has earned a meaningful title as 'The Ramsar Village' for the first time in the world in 2013, thanks to the efforts of residents to keep their forests together.
Camellia Garden
Dongbaekdongsan Forest Trail is gentle and flat, making it easy for children to walk. You can start from the Dongbaekdongsan Visitor Information Center across the Seonchulban Pond and go out to the west exit where Sunchulbun Bridge is located or back to the Wetland Center. The entire trail is about 5km long, and you can take a short walk in 2-3 hours.
Forest path full of green
Camellia Garden Forest Walk in Blue May
Once you enter the forest path, you will instantly enter another world. Forests with green leaves tender young leaves wherever they come into contact with snow, and lush branches of leaves can hide even the sky. Birds sitting on branches twitter with clear sounds, and faintly roaring bells are heard from beyond the forest.
Gotjawal, the mystical nature of Jeju
Every time you step, the leaves are crushed. May in Dongbaekdongsan is a mix of autumn and spring. The young buds are pouting their faces through the thick leaves on the floor. If you turn your eyes up, it soon changes to the season of lush greenery. The mystery of Jeju created by Gotjawal's unique natural environment unfolds before your eyes.
4.3 Bottle Cave with the Pain of Events
The Dongbaek Garden is also a historic place that embraces the pain of the residents. The dotle cave, which was found not long after, was a hideout for the residents who fled the tombs at the time of the 4.3 incident. Although you can't go inside the cave now, you can guess the desperate situation by looking at the entrance over the wire mesh. How many days have you been hiding in a narrow cave? It is a heavy step to turn to the sad heart.
Tree Roots Exposed to the Ground
As we crawled through the thick roots of trees that crawled over the ground and wandered through the natural forest where trees and vines intertwined, we quickly reached the wetland. This is where Ramsar Marsh is designated. Distant water moss, which has been accumulated for a long time in the pit rock lava rock, is a rare wetland that is hard to find in Jeju. The sound of birds coming in from time to time in silence and silence is like a gift from nature. I go on my way back with a calm mind.
Distant mower wetland designated as Ramsar Wetlands
After the exploration of the Dongbaekdongsan Mountain, the boats can be filled at the local restaurant 'Dormuk' at the entrance of the village.
Local restaurant “Doormug” located at the entrance of Sunhul Village
Pork stir-fry and buckwheat pancake are neatly served.
Neatly set meal
Travel info

item.title: "This place in Wonju!" Industrial tourism connecting chocolate, nature, medical equipment, kitchenware, cosmetics
item.description:
Coffee trees grow when you enter <The Chocolate Empress>.

"This place in Wonju!" Industrial tourism connecting chocolate, nature, medical equipment, kitchenware, cosmetics

Wonju, Gangwon, South Korea

The village of Wonju, the gateway to Gangwon-do and the name of Gangwon-do. It is home to the island river and Ganhyeon Amusement Park, boasting clear waters, including Chiaksan (1288m), a large mountain in Yeongseo. Today, I will travel to find a different expression of Wonju. The name is a bit unfamiliar, but if you know it, the fun is 'Industrial Tourism'. Introducing experience-based tours and industrial tourism hotspots for families.
#One. Gather everyone who likes chocolate! Chocolate Empress
Chocolate Empress (CEO Jang Ji-eun), located in Haenggu-dong, Wonju-si, is a restaurant specializing in fermentation chocolate that adds special taste and efficacy to chocolate. Naturally fermented chocolate made after 12 years of investment is matured in Onggi for at least 3 days to give a deep taste.
The building of Chocolate Empress, called Sontak Hotel, is a space for making fermented chocolate and fermented beverages, as well as a cafe, laboratory, and experience space where you can taste them. If you go to this place, you can find a mysterious chocolate that can be stored for more than 100 days by fermentation aging without additives.
There is an experience program for both children and adults. In addition to making bear fermented chocolate for kids 4 to 6 years old (40 ~ 60 minutes, 18,000 won per person) and making cacao cake balls for more than kindergarten students (40 ~ 60 minutes, 15,000 won per person) , Making petals fermented chocolate that can be experienced by elementary school students (60 ~ 90 minutes, 25,000 won per person) and chocolate fondue (30 minutes, 10,000 won per person), cacao cake bar (about 30 minutes, 1 person 1 person) 15,000 won).
Raw chocolate can be stored for a long time by natural fermentation
Many people are also looking for a hand drip coffee experience (90 minutes, 25,000 won per person) for high school students and older. All programs can be applied for more than 4 people. Reservation required one day in advance.
Melting chocolate to make brownies

▶ 16, Gomungol-gil, Wonju-si, Gangwon-do / Sontak Cafe / 033-765-7306 (weekdays)

www.chocohwanghu.co.kr

'Brownie Making Experience' at <The Chocolate Empress>
#2. Healing of body and mind, <Wonju Herb Farm>
Wonju Herb Farm (CEO, Cha Seong-hwan), proud of Wonju, Gangwon-do. Nearly 1,000 species of plants are growing in various gardens and ponds, including rose gardens, livestock gardens, training gardens, indoor gardens, and herb bath gardens.
Main building where you can find herbal drinks, food and products
In particular, the night view and herb foot bath in the colorful garden with thousands of LED lights are popular as a date course of Wonju. The herb foot bath that cats welcome is added to the fee (1000 won).
Ponds filled with outdoor gardens
Wonju Herb Farm is largely divided into indoor buildings and outdoor spaces. The plant museum described above fills the outdoor space, while the three-story building houses cafes, restaurants, and herb shops. You can taste herbal teas, herbal ice cream, herbal pork cutlet and bibimbap, offering a variety of herbal experiences to those looking for Wonju Herb Farm.
Cha Seong-hwan, Director of the Plant
▶ 887-24, Musil-dong, Wonju-si, Gangwon-do / 033-762-3113 / 10: 00 ~ 22: 00 (Closed on Mondays) / Adults 7,000 won, middle and high school students 6000 won, preferential 5,000 won (wonwon citizens 1,000 won discount)
Cha Seong-hwan, Director of the Plant
# 3. Everything in life medical devices! <Wonju Medical Device Support Center>
Wonju Medical Device Support Center, known as Asia's first medical device permanent exhibition. The question of 'what is the place to do' is quickly resolved by visiting the medical device permanent exhibition in Wonju Medical Device Techno Valley.
Medical Device Development Theme Center located in Medical Device Support Center
The most interesting place for visitors is the ‘Sales Zone’. Various medical devices as well as living and beauty devices are on display and sold. In addition to functional cosmetics, it adds variety and is attractive because it can be purchased at a lower price than commercially available.
beauty
It is difficult to see the weekend because of the renewal of the company booth until early July 2015. Anyone can watch from 10 am to 5 pm on weekdays. If you make a reservation in advance, you can add an explanation from the staff of the administration office. The company plans to hold a special exhibition twice a year in spring and autumn. It is useful because you can see and experience useful home care products at home, and then buy them cheaply.
Visitors testing skin condition
▶ 200, Corporate City, Wonju-si, Gangwon-do / 033-760-6100 (Permanent Exhibition), 033-900-5888 (Office) / 10: 00 ~ 17: 00 (Weekends are not available until July 3rd due to corporate booth renewal)
Visitors in Paraffin Bath Experience
#4. <Neoflam> full of colorful eco-friendly kitchen utensils
Neo-Flam (CEO Park Chang-soo), a company specializing in eco-friendly kitchen products, loved by housewives, newlyweds, and self-employed students, built a new nest in Wonju Enterprise City. Neo-Flam, famous for its colorful kitchen utensils, is a combination of 'neo' and 'flam'. Eco-friendly ceramic coated kitchen utensils are attracting the attention of modern people.
Unfortunately, it is difficult to personally visit the Neoflam factory. So far, only groups of 40 or more are available for field trips. You can see a series of products produced in the open factory with transparent windows, and you can also watch and purchase them in the showroom, where various products of Neoflam are displayed. As it is purchased in the field, it can be purchased at a lower price than commercially available. The showroom, which offers pretty kitchen utensils, is impressive.
<Neoflam> Wonju headquarters 1F lobby view
▶ 1 / 080-512-7000 / Group tour of 40 or more people
Neoflam is located in Wonju, both headquarters and factory
# 5. I know if you write a sample, <True Zone>
Charmzone (CEO Kwang-seok Kim), which has been established as a professional cosmetics company for more than 30 years, is headquartered in Gangnam, Seoul, and a factory in Wonju. The Wonju factory exhibits not only cosmetics laboratories, production plants but also the history of Charmzone.
View of Wonju Plant in <Chamzone>
If you want to visit the factory, you must make a reservation by phone. You must wait at least two years from the time of booking.
The tour of the factory begins with the history of
Up to 24 people can apply at once. Only two seasons are visited during the spring and fall seasons. Take the car prepared by the head office and move to Wonju factory.
Factory where you can see the cosmetic production process
Cosmetics that show the history of Charmzone at a glance

▶ 58, Taejanggongdan-ro, Wonju-si, Gangwon-do / 080-022-0204

item.title: Dodeok Mountain, Cloud Mountain, Gahak Mountain
item.description:
Dodeoksan Entrance Village Mural

Dodeok Mountain, Cloud Mountain, Gahak Mountain

Gwangmyeong, South Korea

In Gwangmyeong-si, there is an elongated mountain path that runs from north to south. It is Jongju-gil, Gwangmyeong-si, which extends from Mt. Dodeok to Mt. Cloud, Gahak-san and Seodok. All are low mountains with an altitude of over 200m.
Although a bit of an uphill trail seems like a frequent walkway, the still and magnificent view of the forest is the same. I want to walk on a mountain path, but when the high mountain is a burdensome day, I head toward Jongju-gil following the low mountains of Gwangmyeong-si.
Dodeoksan Park Shelter
Helping me build a virtue into the clouds
At the top of Mt. Dodeok, Dodeokjeong named it the first of the eight gyeongmyeong views. Although it is a very low mountain behind the town at 183.1m above sea level, it is said that Seonbi, who had been heading to the city to see the past, stayed and talked about virtue.
Local History of Gwangmyeong-si in Dodeoksan Park
The trail is divided into several branches, but from either side you will reach the summit in about 30 minutes. Dodeoksan Park, located nearby, is a haven for residents and visitors. There are artificial waterfalls, fountains, outdoor stages, lawn plazas, and wildflower complexes. Every time there are various events for citizens.
Doukjeong stamp of the 1st view of Gwangmyeong 8 Views
Walk a little further toward the summit and you'll find a pretty well-designed morality. Even if it is low, the view on the moral road is beautiful. Overlooking the summit of Mt. Gwanak.
Dodeokjeong panoramic view

There is a Cloud Mountain Tunnel on the way down from Mt. Next to it is a night town with a special food culture street. There are a variety of restaurants, including Western and Korean food. Some of them are already recognized as gourmet, and many people come to hear the rumors. If you think of the schedule up to the foot of the West Doksan mountain, it is good to go down Dokdeok Mountain and enjoy a meal at night village. In the village of Ante, which is next to the village at night, there is an Ante Ecological Park, which is home to a native flower garden, ecological water purification media, and an ecological forest. Cloud Mountain is located in the center of Gwangmyeong-si and is 237m high and is the highest among the mountains in Gwangmyeong-si. The mountain in the former name Avanturi was called Abangbong, but it was called Mt. The Cloud Mountain Road has several trails. Depending on the course, you can walk a wide range of 8km long and 1km short. The road that leads directly to the summit of Mt.

Cloud Mountain Tunnel direction
Pass through the lush forest path to the edge of Gwangmyeong-si
It's not as high as the name says, but the cloud forest is very cozy. The forest became more dense since it was established as an environmental forest in 2013. As you head to the summit, the noise on the road gradually diminishes, and the lush forest relaxes you like any landscape in the highlands. The charm of Cloud Mountain is that the road is quiet and you can walk quietly and leisurely. In the middle of the easy road, the middle mountain is a mountain. It is not a very steep or very dangerous route, but it is always necessary to step on fallen leaves and finely-grained soil.
Even in the cold winter winds, whenever a drop of sweat on the forehead creates a peregrine vertebra, a shelter with a wooden chair emerges. It's a low mountain, so it's a good idea to take a short break when you start breathing. There are several springs around the mountain. There are seven hiking trails that lead to the summit of Mt. Cloud, which passes different springs along the way, but all are certified as drinking water by water quality test. It is safe and the taste of water is constant so that the people's footsteps can not stop in the morning.
Cloud Mountain Spring
A weak spring near the summit heralds the final ascent. Considering the height and difficulty of the mountain, this is the section where steep dolmen begins. It is hard to come to the temple, stop and look up at the sky, and you can see the roof of Unsanjeong on the summit. Even though this moment is the hardest in the world, it always passes in the blink of an eye. The view below the mountain is different from Mt. The cloud sperm seems to rise to the top like a lighthouse at the top of the island, while the morality is in the middle of it.
Unamjeong at the top of the mountain
Down the mountain along a gentle ridge

Gahak-san is 220m above sea level, about 20m lower than cloud mountain. On the other hand, the distance is 2.5km and the course is long. It can be seen without walking that the road from the summit of Mt. Military units are located on the Gadaksan Mountain and further west of the mountain. A barbed wire runs from the cloud to the other side of the road. There is a no-access zone, so use the designated hiking trails.

Communication resting place between Cloud Mountain and Gahak Mountain
Gahak-dong, where Gahak-san is located, is a town named after the cranes that surrounded the village. Gahak-san is said to have a crane bearing eggs in feng shui geography.
Hiking trail
It is a mining village that used to be Siheung mine. At the crossroads below the summit of Kahak Mountain, the direction of Kahak Mine Cave can be reached, but cave viewing is not possible until April 2015.
Top
The summit and sperm are also located at the top of Gahak Mountain. There is an observation deck on the deck observatory next to the sperm, and a panoramic photo engraved with the names of the mountains viewed from the side. Although it is difficult to distinguish clearly with the eyes, it is possible to glimpse the mountains of Ansan and the sea near the west.
Gahaksan Observatory
The Hassan route from Gahak-san to West Doksan is very short. On the map, there is no official trail to the summit of West Doksan. It is best not to go on rare mountain trails.
Stone tower met on the way to Seodoksan
Follow the milestones toward the summit of Seodok Mountain, and it will not be long before you come to the observatory, where Seodokjeong is located below. The old scholars were named here to read the book. In the future, KTX Gwangmyeong History is visible. It is a good idea to go around Seodokjeong and use the wooden stairs to descend into history. The trails are entangled in several directions, so if you wander around the road, you can go back to Gahak Mountain.
West Doksan Observatory
mountain
West German Notice

item.title: Looking for a gourmet restaurant in Wonju traditional market that is eccentric and twice as tasty
item.description:
Wonju Kimchi dumplings

Looking for a gourmet restaurant in Wonju traditional market that is eccentric and twice as tasty

Wonju, Gangwon, South Korea

Wonju, the city you will meet when you run the Yeongdong Expressway towards the East Sea. I found hidden fun in Wonju, which I thought was a passing city. It is located in every corner of the Central Market. It is also fun to visit the Jungjung Traditional Market facing the Central Market and the Pungmul Market every 2 and 7 days. Loosen the belts when looking around the market.

Delicious and inexpensive, Wonju Central Market
If you're very hungry, or wondering about the most famous restaurant in the Central Market, don't wander and visit Wonju Kimchi Dumpling (033-745-3848). This dumpling house has been for three generations for over 40 years.
The family that runs dumplings in the face of the handicapped has become more famous as it is introduced in TV documentaries. Not to mention the taste of dumplings. The guests who filled the dining table reassure the first visitor.
The lady who was introduced to a TV program and became a celebrity
The representative menu of this house is Kalmandu. It is a hearty menu of kalguksu and dumplings. It's good to have your own kalguksu noodles, but the texture of dumplings with plenty of cabbage kimchi is incomparable to any other dumplings in other regions.
Kal dumplings to taste both kalguksu
If you want to taste the dumplings, order kimchi dumplings boiled in boiling water. The thick but chewy dumplings and the crispy dumplings are in harmony, so your hands keep going even though you are full.
Warm kimchi dumplings
Fried dumplings fried with freshly made dumplings are also special.
Crispy Fried Dumplings
Buckwheat jeon, which is made of thin buckwheat dough with Chinese cabbage and green onions, is a food often encountered while visiting Wonju's market. The buckwheat jeon, which can never be imitated without the grandmother's hands, is a taste of Gangwon-do, with a light taste and simple emotion.
Buckwheat noodle made with grandma's taste
The price is good with just 1,000 won for 2-3 pieces. Buckwheat Buckwheat (033-745-1644) is one of the most praised buckwheat collections.
Buckwheat jeon tasted in the rural marketplace of Gangwon-do becomes a memory
Many young people visit the Central Market because they are connected to the street of Jung-dong Culture called Myeong-dong. The free market next to the central market is a modern mall. If you go down to the first floor, there are small restaurants that sell Korean representative snacks, Tteokbokki, Tempura, and Sundae. There are restaurants in the form of seats, but there are signboards such as Friendship House, Tonere, and Friendly Tteokbokki.
Tteokbokki Town, B1, Free Market
If you order one serving, you can mix various tempura with Tteokbokki according to your taste. Soup with a piece of fish paste is a service. It is a spot where light students eat and chatter.
Tteokbokki and tempura mixed with spicy sauce
On the opposite side of the underground passage there was one restaurant waiting in line.
Entrance to 'Hard home wherever you find'
Does it mean that it is hard to find in the corner of the basement? Or does it mean that it's hard to find a restaurant like this? 'Hard home to find it' (033-745-0031) is a place where you can taste special cutlet. If you eat it with spicy rice balls or spicy rice balls or tteokbokki, it's a great meal. Pork cuts are ground twice a day and fried at the same time as the order. Kim Don is made of rice balls topped with neat pork cutlet and spicy kimchi toppings. You can have several different menus. Kodonburo is also a popular dish, with fried cheese and vegetables. The low price of less than 6,000 won is also attractive, but the interior of the café on the second floor of the attic is a great way to attract young people.
Pork cutlet and rice ball of 'Hard house to find no matter where you find'
On the other side of the passage is a snack shop, the newlyweds (033-745-8037). Here too, you should be prepared to wait in line at mealtime. Although it is famous for myeon, there are also a variety of meal menus such as dolsot bibimbap, omelet rice, and miscellaneous vegetables. The highest price is just 4,500 won. Don't doubt the taste.
Newlywed Couples Filled with Young Customers
Try a specialty hidden in a narrow alley, Jungwon Traditional Market
If you fill up your stomach and leave the Central Market, you will find the Jungwon Traditional Market. If the central market is the center of food, the Jungwon Traditional Market is lined with clothing and grocery stores, so it's easy to walk and watch.
Hanwoo Alley, which has been alive since late afternoon, is a spot in the Jungwon Traditional Market that everyone knows. After opening the door, there are about 10 restaurants lined up in a narrow alley where you can bump into the nose of someone coming out of the store. At first glance, it has a shabby appearance and few tables, but you need to make a reservation to settle down in the evening. It is popular because you can taste special parts such as Korean beef meat, insole meat at reasonable prices. It is a friendly alley where you can face a forehead on a small brazier and share a drink at a piece of meat.
Hanwoo Alley in Jungwon Traditional Market
If you step inside the Korean beef alley, you can taste the tadpoles. Corn paste, which has passed through a coarse sieve, is often introduced on TV as it falls into hot water and ripens into a tadpole.
Drain the water and put it in a jar
If you're curious about the taste, look for Grandmother's tadpole (033-743-6473). Season the tadpole noodles from the water with soy sauce and chopped kimchi with garnish. The sesame salt you put in to add sue adjusts to your taste.
'Grandmother tadpole' in the alley
In Wonju, it is not called tadpole noodles but tadpoles. The way of eating is similar to mukbap but does not use broth separately. Crunchy kimchi and soft ladle noodles are cool and light. If the weather gets cold, you can eat it warmly.
Tadpole noodles with kimchi garnish
The central passage is the alley. It is a place where you can taste all kinds of temples that are eaten during sacrifices and holidays.
'Delicacies' in Alleys
Meet every 5 days, the taste of Pungmul Market

If you find 2, 7 on the date you found Wonju, the visit to Pungmul Market is a bonus. You may plan a weekly outing on the day of the market. As Wonju was the largest market place in the Gangwon region, it is a market that inherits its traditions and gathers a variety of daily necessities including agricultural and marine products.

If you pass by today, let's meet the restaurants of Pungmul Market where you have to wait 5 days again. 'Jangterukbap' (033-734-7929) is a common restaurant that sells Sundae Gukbap and Kalguksu on days when there is no market, but it turns into a feast day after day. This is because buckwheat pancakes are made with buckwheat pancakes and mung bean pancakes. You can choose the food you want to eat in the restaurant.
Quail House, featuring food stalls
The quail-style “Quilt House” without a phone number grills various kinds of seafood such as squid, quails and skewers on a charcoal fire. Older seniors are hungry for simple snacks, but they offer a unique experience for travelers who go to oil field outings for unusual sights. It is also a tourist's privilege to take a leisurely tour of those who have gone out for shopping with a bowl of warm mussel bath.
Wholesale Shop Opening After Sale
Travel info

item.title: Take the train, Chungju Samtan Amusement Park & Indeungsan
item.description:
Samtan Station and Chungbuk Line Train

Take the train, Chungju Samtan Amusement Park & Indeungsan

Chungju, Chungbuk, South Korea

Water play that reminds me of summer and water play in scenic nature is a fresh play. With the romantic romance of the train, the pleasure of traveling multiplies, regardless of time.
In front of the train station, Samtan Amusement Park where water, forest and mountains are combined. Camping is easy to leave, and it is easy to use the accommodations that are located next to the amusement park. It is also a good idea to have a regular mountain climbing mountain. On the way back, enjoy sightseeing near Chungju Station, and your trip will be more enriching. Let's leave by train, Chungju!
Jupocheon from the Samtan Bridge
Samtan Amusement Park by train track
Samtan Amusement Park is located at Sancheok-myeon, Chungju-si, Chungbuk. The train to Samtan Amusement Park is good. This is because there is an amusement park about 500 meters from Samtan Station. Pass the Samtan Bridge right in front of the station and follow the road to Myeongdol Village. Samtan means three streams, such as government office, pine and barnacle. Jupocheon, which leads to the Namhan River, flows around the amusement park.
Myeongdol Village Entrance Seats and Sports Park
In the past, the people were rare enough to stay with them, but in 1958 trains passing through Samtan Station were extended to form villages and amusement parks. In June 2000, a sports park was created next to the amusement park. Recently, a natural grass soccer field has been set up in the center of the park. Most of the facilities in the amusement park can be used free of charge, but lawn parks require a maintenance fee after booking.
Athletic Park
In addition to the turf field, the vacant lot can also be used as a camping ground. The large campsite makes it easy to find a place to go. There are also facilities such as toilet, drinking fountain and parking lot.
Jopocheon and amusement park gravel under the train tracks

The malls along the funfair ramp combine restaurants, canteens and bed and breakfasts. You can rent or buy some fishing gear as well as some simple fishing gear. Every summer, residents work together to improve the environment around the park. This year, from July 16th to August 15th, an environmental information center and Saemaul Library will be run by 200 residents. The Environmental Information Center is a voluntary activity that creates a clean environment for vacationers by removing garbage and collecting recyclables around the amusement park. Saemaul Library has over 2,000 books available for free rental and leads a healthy holiday culture. Residents in charge of the river reside in preparation for safety accidents.

Midsummer Willow

The amusement park is surrounded by mountains, and the odd rock cliffs are superbly located across the main stream. The river is wide and the water level is varied, so it is good for children to adults. Gravel fields spread out next to the sports park. There is a lush forest on top of it, and rich trees such as willows make the shade.

Amusement park next to sports park
Receive the energy of three
Indeungsan is a 667m high mountain located just behind the amusement park. It belongs to Cheondeungsan (807m) in the north and Jideungsan (535m) in the south, and belongs to Samdeungsan which means Cheon, Ji, and Injae. Sandeungsan is known for being sheltered from the mountains and deep in valleys. In addition, the legend is said that if one crosses all three mountains, one wish will be fulfilled.
Train passing railroad crossing by the amusement park
Cheondeungsan Mountain is named after the top of the mountain. The trail is not easy. Along with Bakdaljae, he became famous as a popular song <Crying Bakdaljae>, but in fact, about 9km away from Cheondeungsan and Wonseocheon, it belongs to Mt.
Samtan Amusement Park from the Beginning of the Trail
Jideung Mountain is a mountain that is connected to Indeung Mountain. In climbing is a mountain that can be climbed without difficulty. While walking to the summit, the scenery is beautiful, and on a good day, you can look down to Chungju Lake.
Forest road heading to the observatory
When the weather is too hot, it's a good idea to walk along the forest road to the observation deck.
Hiking trail by the valley
It is about 3km from Samtan Amusement Park to Observation Deck. Passing the mall opposite the amusement park leads you to the apple orchard. When you enter the road, you will be able to walk around the mountain. Do not enter the valley road, it is good to follow the road. There are no milestones on the mountain trail next to the valley, so you can wander around.
Observation Deck 700m
If you climb about 1.7km from the entrance, you will come to a three-way street. Follow the signs to the right for about 700m to reach the observatory. If you climb the observatory, you can see the Cheondeungsan Mountain opposite you and face the river flowing under the mountain.
The area of Jideungsan from the Cheonjiin Observatory
The train tracks seen from the mountain are also superb views.
Village seen from the observation deck
Chungju caliber on the way back

Before heading home, let's go from Samtan Station to Chungju Station in time for the train. Jungang Top Park is located about 7km from Chungju Station. It is called the tower in the center of Korea. Its historical name is Joongwon Papyeong-ri Seven-storied pagoda. It is the largest stone pagoda in the Unified Shilla Era. It is currently designated as National Treasure No. 6. In 1992, a historic park was built around the pagoda, and in 2007, the park facility was built along with the reorganization and repair work around the central pagoda. Inside the park are Chungju Museum 1 and 2, an open-air museum and a music hall. A music fountain is installed on Tangeum Lake in front of the park.

Next to the park is the World Liquor Museum. Visit the Wine History and Culture Museum for information about wine. There is also an experience facility where you can listen to the whiskey ripening process and taste the whiskey in oak barrels. A collection of beers, spirits, and oriental alcohol from around the world. The liquor of our country attracts people's attention by displaying traditional and modern wine more carefully. In addition to the exhibition halls, a separate education center will be operated and mainstream culture and fermentation science experiences will be conducted. Anyone can join in advance.
Jungwon Tappyeong Seven-storied Pagoda in Jungang Pagoda Park
There are many charming restaurants around the museum. Next door is Tangeumho International Rowing Center. Tangeum Lake was formed during the construction of Chungju Dam in 1985. Until 2004, the stadium was used as a water sports park for the general public and as a training ground for rowers. In summer, the Chungju Lake Festival is held in this area, and water sports activities are free for the general public.
Museum of World Liquor Culture
Travel info
